wj7h7YW-2hcR5kHyo6DfoA.text: I love this place I have been to every Sushi Samba location. I was actually surprised because the one in London has the most beautiful atmosphere of all. The view is AMAZING and the decor as well. I had read a few bad reviews for the service but when I was there even though it was a busy night service was great. We asked to change tables and at the moment they had a reservation on that table but as soon that they realized the table was not showing up anymore they moved us. The food is still a little less good that in the Vegas but almost perfect. Great place for a date!

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. The view
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. sushi rolls with a view

hvaHYow0owDG5Uj5QhDbNQ.text: Great views, poor food. Drenched in sauce most of the time for no reason. Delicate food like the foie gras and salmon was unnecessarily soaked in the topping, making it hard to taste either the salmon or the foie gras. Same issue with the shrimp tempura. The wagyu beef gyoza have a poor filling-dough ratio. Thumbs up for the green bean tempura and the great aioli on the side. Tip: get a table by the window but in that case, bring a long-sleeve top because you may end up right under the very powerful aircon.

SyquLpLx86FkeXUAeuoZhg.text: We wanted to check out SushiSamba for our blog, UrbanVistas, so of course we had to try out the food while we were there.The lift up to the 39th floor is a thrill ride in to itself, but luckily didn't have my stomach too aflutter as to ruin my appetite.The restaurant décor is uncomplicated (why taint the view with unnecessary decoration?). The staff were welcoming and we never once felt out of place for wearing jeans or wandering around to take in the view. We didn't feel quite brave enough to sit on the outside 'mezzanine', but we did manage to bag the best seat in the place  a quiet table for two looking out east/north-east/west, which gave us amazing views of the Olympic Park, and our home icon of Alexandra Palace.Although the fusion of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian sounds like a strange marriage, the food is exquisite. That obviously comes at a price, but then you are paying for the view as well as the food. Our pick of the dishes would have to include the pork belly wraps and the showy but fantastic Yuzu Meringue 'Tart', which was worth the wait to get it to our table.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom

yEo4Hr0c-zo_bSnHXPknCQ.text: SushiSamba is located at the top of the Heron Tower, which by the way is so high up, I see God. In my opinion, the only part I loved most about SushiSamba was the lift up to the bar. It goes so fast and you get to see the whole view of the City. It gives you a great buzz and gave me great excitement to see the bar.However, I have to say I was disappointed. Poor interior, poor service, painful prices.I didn't try the sushi unfortunately, only a glass of Rosé. The terrace however, was very cute. It had a completely different atmosphere and the thought that you're standing outside on a very high building is a great feeling.I'm sure if I tried the cocktails or the food, I'd have a more positive opinion but I have no plans of returning.From the whole SushiSamba experience which my friends always raved about, I have to say the lift up to the bar was the only exciting part. And the lift down.

9Opyq7gSkYfQp5IQBNH9SQ.text: VERY disappointed by SS. Sushi was overpriced for what it was. The rolls were okay. Based on sushi alone, I would give this place three stars, but the service wasn't great. We ordered miso soup as an appetizer and received the soups 10 minutes after our main course (cut rolls) had arrived. Isn't miso soup pretty easy to make? We ordered green tea and received matcha (nothing special), but we're very surprised to see the charge for green tea was nine pounds! I've been to the SS in New York, and I have to say, my experience was 100x better there.

1P9Ihe_bT9tA4pYT0yiSxw.text: Went to sushisamba for my birthday, and I have to say, as a seasoned sushi-eater, this is the best sushi I have eaten in the UK. The menu is large enough to cater to everybody's tastes, and the waiting staff are extremely helpful and knowledgable about the menu. One of the major attractions of sushisamba is the view from the restaurant. The views over London are spectacular - if you can get a window seat, it will transform a wonderful meal to an experience you will never forget. The bar outside is a great place to grab a drink after your meal and the views are just spectacular. If you like sushi, or are trying it for the first time, this place is a must!

NM1UDa7ghIac43mxxqd3XQ.text: Expensive, but the food is like nothing I've ever tried before. Great for a special occasion.

6lf_EhzdHORkIuJRJS2S0g.text: I really enjoyed the experience at SushiSamba. Obviously, the atmosphere and view from the 38th floor is one of the biggest things SS has going for it. Pretty impressive.The service was also quite prompt and helpful.The only thing keeping this from getting 5 stars from me was that food was very good, but perhaps just shy of top notch. Admittedly, the primary fare that SS has is not necessarily my favorite, so perhaps I'm not a good judge. That being said, the yellowtail taquitos, black cod, and plaintain chips were all very good. I did think the "With Love From Rio" dessert was outstanding.

U03P62U-_Sxm09nCaxApWg.text: I want to rate this place higher, and higher, and higher, and higher, but the views from the 38th floor of the Heron tower are just not enough to save this restaurant as an absolute top sushi joint for me. I much prefer the "small things come in big packages" approach (meaning, find a neighbourhood sushi joint that will knock your trowsers off).The outside bar is way cool - with a huge orange steel tree in the centre. Plan ahead or you'll never get a seat. Of the few cocktails on the menu, one of them is a mojito - so they lose points for creativity in my opinion. For a fusion restaurant combining two of the world most eclectic cuisines (Japanese and South American) I would have expected more creative margaritas, caipirinhas, sake-based cocktails, etc.  If you do go, try the "shiso-fine". Best cocktail on the list.Once inside, the food is inconsistently decent. Round One: The Yellowtail Taquitos and the Rock Shrimp Tempura are amazing!Round Two: The Pork Belly wraps are good as well but they are gone before you realise what you have on your plate. Be careful to ask about portion sizes. Many items only come with x2 or x4 per plate so if your a group of three(3), which we were, the servers don't exactly go out of their way to inform you. Round Three: The sushi rolls. They are decent - but don't expect bang-up-amazing-melt-in-your-mouth cuts of fish. Stay clear of the El Topo roll, unless your going to eat it up quickly. Once the mozzarella sits for two long it becomes more like dried-up toothpaste. Not cool.I have to say that the sushi/sashimi was pretty good.Would I go again? Yes, but at about 60.00-80.00 per person it's not really worth it for dinner. The views are stunning but you can get better consistent quality sushi elsewhere. If you want to impress someone, or plan a daytime date, pick a clear day and do lunch. You might catch me there.

FG3MnXVOhiAyhXsEhV9w8w.text: Beautiful location and amazing views of all of London with trendy decor and good food. We did have a ridiculous wait for dinner but stuck through it and made it in finally.  We ordered edamame to start and followed with the robata steak and aubergine. We also had the El Toro roll which was okay but a little heavy for my taste. There were a couple other dishes I'm missing but I'd love to go back for drinks again.

JbL0UcM-emQXoC2odIVH0g.text: Hmm..where to start.The obvious.The venue is really cool, high up above London (I think I could see my house!), and subsequently the views are pretty amazing.With great views come great prices (great = high) which is to be expected (3 short cocktails = £45) and therefore with great prices come loads of Banker types (me included) and lots of well dressed women, which is never a bad thing, so points for that no doubt.The cocktails were pretty good, a right amount of kick, and mixture of flavours.Now there is a proper restaurant attached to this bar, and I assume the food is the same as the sushi a few friends and I had in this place, but the sashimi we had was not good. Perhaps it was end of service, perhaps it was because we went a few weeks after it had opened, but paying ~£30 for 9 pieces of sashimi, I would have thought that it would have tasted a better than what I thought was a bit cardboardy which was pretty disappointing to say the least.I would go back there for a Client/work event and gladly try the food again, or to take my better half for a panoramic cocktail, but aside from that, I probably wouldnt.

Jr8Ir63K1F7cVCzfPumakg.text: I will be honest, I thought it was going to be completely rubbish but I was blown away. I had a great evening, the staff were lovely and the food was outstanding.From a food snob who usually picks holes, highly recommend!

bS5k8FoOJVozrGPJan41Wg.text: Great sushi, great view, and good people watching.  I love the Sushi Samba in NYC and this one did not disappoint.

SiG5DU7JlhPPzgjlzM4d6w.text: While I am not one for chains and not one for scenes and am not a big fan of overpriced drinks and food, I still think this place is pretty stellar.  I mean is there any place you'd rather be on a clear night in London?  By the time we got there (9:30 on a Thursday) they weren't serving at the outside bar but still, that place is spectacular).  We were probably seated around 10 (so 30 minute wait) at the counter (didn't see what was upstairs--assume more restaurant-style seating).  Service was spotty--they couldn't keep our order straight with the people next to us.  But many of the dishes were really good--the tiradito with jalapeno was awesome, and these fried green beans with truffle sauce were to die for.  Also enjoyed pork belly lettuce wraps.  The sushi isn't as exciting as the other offerings.  While I didn't look at the bill (luckily I was being treated) I know it was hella expensive.  So be forewarned.  But enjoy a cocktail, take in the view, enjoy the scene of people who want to spend money and see and be seen, have some "crack" green beans and call it a good night....

qd2eAXwO25ku2h8dVY_43A.text: It's worth a visit even if only for the view from the elevator. Cocktails are pretty pricy, but they're amazing. The view isn't as great as from the Shard especially if your table is int he middle of the restaurant, but the food quality makes up for it!

xVcdO-H1OxOKaV6UFLS3mQ.text: Epic views, epic outdoor terrace, and epic price tag to match. Worth the splurge, however! Went at lunch just for drinks, and there was plenty of space and instant service - imagine it would get busy towards the evening however.Nice fire in a pit on the terrace to keep the chill of the stratosphere at bay, and you really do feel like you're in the clouds. Really recommend for a fantastic bar that can't be matched by many.Will certainly be back!

W0cxKmNfkiQ6D0YoeDMLtg.text: Sushi Samba is one if my favourite sushi places in London - bar Nobu. But the one thing that consistently let's Sushi Samba down is the staff. They are typically rude like most upscale restaurants in London. On Saturday I visited with a friend and waited 20 minutes at the outside bar for a drink. It wasn't busy but the bartender next to us chatted for 30 minutes before turning to us to day 'your better off going inside for a drink - it'll be quicker' I was literally shocked to silence. The restaurant staff were great - as usual and the food was also it's usual high standard - but I think this was the last straw for me. Sorry Sushi Samba - I'll stick with Nobu.

-vwPtXh1U2NjP9nfMHEQww.text: The view is amazing, the food was very good and the cocktails were clever and (for the most part) quite good! I recommend the Pesco sour. The rolls were inventive and interesting and there is plenty of good stuff to choose between. The spicy squid stater was my fave! I'd definitely go back... If work was paying for it again.. ;)

U3B2UacxnCwxRrE3dDoq3Q.text: Dizzying views above London's East End combined with good food and cocktails make Sushi Samba a great place for a special occasion. It's not cheap, but the atmosphere makes it worth the price tag. Definitely an evening to remember.

m4bLLX7cUb5yQ_rLTgRmFw.text: An amazing location with incredible views, the bar is reason enough to go up for a drink. If you are lucky enough to be able to get a booking to eat then you're in for a treat. The food is some of the best I've tasted in London. The staff have great recommendations and seem very knowledgeable if you're not to sure what to order.Advice would be to book in advance though as this place gets very busy, I was trying to book 2 months + in advance!

NO4h7fVdy8DoizMl1iwD7A.text: I really wasn't impressed with Sushi Samba, we walked in, were told we could only sit at the bar to wait for a table, (that this was full), then when we found this uncomfortable, to try the duck and waffle restaurant upstairs. They suggested we try the middle floor, who apparently had space, but sent us to the first floor as both floor restaurants were the same company, and we were then taken to the middle floor which was void of people!The sushi was okay - We ordered the London and the São Paulo Samba rolls and edamame, but weren't that impressed or i personally didn't find anything outstanding about the meal.It was overpriced and you only got a few pieces for each roll - at about £15-£16 a roll, I thought this was a bit of a rip off if I'm going to be honest. There are so many lovely sushi restaurants around London of far better quality and value.I wouldn't mind if we were paying for the view, but the window was hazed up with moisture which gave London a very 'diffused' focus.I did like the with love from Rio desert, but for £12 a pop, you're going to be expecting some nice flavours going on.Not somewhere that I would try again. I wasn't keen on the atmosphere, price or food.However on that note, the Heron tower itself is very much worth a visit, being one of my favourite places in London, although next time I'll stick to just having a cocktail at the bar or check out the duck and waffle!

wnc4TVOqm-Bjb86X8SdLgg.text: Probably more expensive than it should be but I wasn't paying so I certainly enjoyed my evening. I attended a sushi-making tutorial which was fun, friendly and educational. Note the excellent selection of Sake (I didn't know there was such variation)!I thoroughly enjoyed my night but think the prices are well out of whack with what you get. Plenty of people are happy to pay over the odds to be seen in the place but, for me, this is why it only warrants an average score.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Help! Make your own food in this great, friendly environment...
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. This is the delicious sushi I made at a class given at SUSHIsamba

kxeG16aFCkd5FiOcmCnOlQ.text: I'm an overall fan of SushiSamba & Duck and Waffle, and I find the drinks and the food delish if not a tad minimal. We tried a load of different sushis and rolls, and though arguably not big portions, the quality of the dishes themselves is high. The uni was SO fresh, it was shocking. We all know I loves me a good uni. I wish the menu were more extensive. I hate not being given much of a choice, especially when starving after having been at D&W for an hour chugging on the champers. Omg I just said champers. Can I get off please. Also - this place is expensive kids - Dinner for two with a bottle of champagne came out to £ 312, and considering we had had drinks upstairs before, the soiree came in at over 500. But that view is DAYUM. Like, DAYUM.

WxeEz4ZoxQLXbtjNHAqZGA.text: Food and views are to absolutely to die for. I still have dreams of the yellowtail sashimi. A great mix of Brazilian and Japanese flavours, and a perfect place to take someone who may not be as hardcore of a sushi fan as you are as there are plenty of non-raw dishes to order off of the menu. The only thing I don't like is how they rush you throughout your meal as they only allow a certain time for each reservation. I feel that to do this at a restaurant that exceeds a certain price point is just a bit tacky to be honest. We went to dinner with friends that we hadn't seen in ages and wanted to just relax and enjoy our meal. However, we were pressured and rushed to order ASAP and it just didn't feel very relaxing. They obviously value turning tables over a high quality dining experience. For that reason alone, I wouldn't return here with someone I wanted to really catch up with. Would probably only come back with my husband alone when we were happy to have a quick dinner.

JX2VvWG1DA2Rr1qkQ6htWg.text: Been here a few times for drinks and once for dinner.For drinks I would advise getting there very early (at about 5pm!) as it gets really busy.The outdoor area is fun in the summer.The restaurant was lovely and the food delicious. Do book well in advance though as you'll struggle to get a table otherwise.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Chilling at sushisamba before lunch

hKPjMBS0TR-ez1rGO6L5Xg.text: I am in looooove !!!! the views.... the food...the cocktails! I can't even describe this place!......the prices :( I'm so in love with this place I just need to get a better job so I can come here once a week! Right now its about once or twice a year I can come here. The restaurant has amazing views over all of London its at the top of a very tall sky scrapper. Book in advance as booking fills up weeks before hand. This place is a must try!

Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Tree on the 38th floor
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Lift to the 38th floor

G2gRore94ptZJWP0xOAmGw.text: The food rating 4 from 5 and the view is amazing must see . Nice interior design good service . We went for dinner but should go at lunch time , average price for this view and location , we order many sea food and beef , beef was amazing and the chicken too , avocado roll nice 2

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Must order -dessert
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom

ccskMSxJWE1ED3JsU3IDNQ.text: My friends and I came for early dinner on a Thursday to experience the hype of Sushi Samba...everything was fine but nothing spectacular. The food and drinks tasted good but for the price were nothing special. The service was decent but definitely felt rushed. The hostess came over to ask us to move to the bar before we even had the chance to pay the bill, as the waitress had not been back to our table. The views are great and the restaurant is very pretty, but for all of the talk about dress code it does not appear that it was being followed. The bar was very crowded and my friends and I chose not to stay. Overall, I would have probably preferred a meal at The Shard.

06eAXEDwT7h-PqWHxj0yxw.text: I like to look down on people.Sushisamba is one awesome place at which to do so. This is really just a review for the views, which were spectacular. I didn't eat, just came for a drink. And a sneer. Eff it's a grand skyline from up there, worth seeing. The glass elevator ride alone made me giggle. So go check it out. Great for visiting company or just that good ole craving for the feeling of superiority that comes from knowing you're higher than over 99% of the rest of London and its inhabitants. At 230 meters, Heron Tower is the third tallest building in London. So there.

tw_89ATTJDfPuvGKfTMUaA.text: Get your wallet out folks, this is gonna be a big 'un! Shoes and smarts only to fly your way skyward in the glass roof into the heavens. Personally I have to face the door and pray, it's the only way I can make my way to the top without hyperventilating.Cocktails are amazing, mine, with chilli and vodka (a savoury concoction) even came with a seabass sushi garnish - yes, I know, bizarre. Drink and dinner all in one mouthful. So good though. Food is sumptuous. Small plates stylee. Share 3/4 each and get a gob-full of everything. The miso cod is ridiculous, the pork belly is sublime - need I go on? It's sooo good The view ain't half bad either - staring down at the tiny world below from the floor to ceiling windows. If you can take your eyes off your food that is. At £100 a pop each though, it's not for the faint-hearted or the pennypinchers. Save, splurge, enjoy!

5TcaukhixsX1t_cL2J2YOQ.text: Sushi Samba is one of the coolest places in the city. It's rare for me to go somewhere and admire the high caliber of good-looking people in one place at the same time. Seriously... really good looking people. I can't even count the number of men (& women) I was checking out as I walked through the bar. This place is so cool... it's up on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower and you have a wonderful view of the city, smack dab right next to The Gherkin. It's trendy, the people are well-dressed, and the drinks are really good. I went into Sushi Samba a few nights ago for dinner and I got a nice window seat (even though it was a kinda cloudy day... surprise surprise). The drinks Pablo something and Shiso Fine were fantastic. The Yellowtail taquitos were like little mini raw fish tacos. The Samba London and Sao Paulo rolls were pretty good. The Salmon Ceviche was alright. Don't get me wrong... if you're expecting authentic sushi, you've come to the wrong place. The fusion of Japanese with South American flair is what Sushi Samba is all about. The menu is creative and although it's not the most amazing fusion ever, they still deliver tasty combinations. Come here for the view and the experience. The atmosphere of the restaurants at The Heron Tower is some of the best in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Yellowtail Taquitos
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Samba London, Sao Paulo, and Shiso Fine cocktails
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Salmon Ceviche

tHhfKjovnLzqL-jqB6kWsw.text: Despite the absurdly difficult booking availability and upscale price range, the food certainly delivered - even for vegetarians. This twinned with a rather fortunate table by the windows overlooking the fabulous London skyline made for a great Sunday lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Passion Fruit Cake Green Tea and White Chocolate Ganache, Raspberry Sorbet, Coconut tuile, fresh raspberries, passion fruit.

c2dTAC01dCtdxNCACrfejQ.text: Went here for my fathers 61st and holy cRAP. The food is AMAZING!! I never would have thought that Peruvian and Asian cuisine would go together so well and yet it does!! Their cocktails are also spot on. It is expensive and the portions can be rather small, but I think it's worth it if you go for a special event!!

BEsQL7nzUtZTaoSktpCp9A.text: I don't get home sick very often but it does help that there are so many restaurants that I adore in NY starting to pop up in London.  There are a couple of Sushi Sambas in NY but in comparison - the London location is absolutely stunning.  Its one of those places where you start to feel a little sexier just being in the place.  One of my friends worked on the landscape - so that gorgeous orange tree out in the bar is her work of art.  I was only there for drinks the other night but I'd definitely like to come back for dinner soon.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Outdoor bar

HPdfM50qxtNh9TLb6X7sSw.text: Haven't eaten here but it does have a great cocktail bad with a great view of London. I think I end up having all the cocktails on the menu.  The Lychee one is great on a summers day! This is a good place to start the evening before going onto to eat dinner somewhere. I personally heard the food is good but in all honesty the prices are very high. So I would recommend coming here for drinks actually which are reasonable.

ju74K5c_o8cFhZcXjZTn3w.text: I'm generally a fan of the hole-in-the-wall compared to the over-hyped restaurant, but SushiSamba actually lived up to expectations and would absolutely recommend.To begin with, the restaurant is beautiful. I loved the overall decor, the soft orange lighting and general ambiance of the restaurant. Also not bad when you look left or right to see stunning views of London.The food was top-notch. SushiSamba reminded me just how good sushi can be (also reminded me how unfulfilling a mere few pieces can be but such is life I suppose). We ordered the Tokyo Sky Tree and Sao Paulo rolls which were first rate. I thoroughly enjoyed both, but in particular loved the Sao Paulo which had truffle! As a true truffle fiend, I'm not sure how I've never come across truffle laden sushi before. It's one for the books to be sure. Another standout was certainly the black cod miso. I can feel the cod melting in my mouth just typing about it. Drinks were pricey but good. Nothing I absolutely loved (I'd say the drinks tended to be on the sweeter side which isn't quite my thing), but would recommend the smoked plum negroni to other whisky lovers out there.Service couldn't have been better. The waiter was helpful, walking us through the menu and recommending how much to order once he learned it was our first (definitely not last!) time at SushiSamba.Take people here to impress but expect it to cost a pretty penny!

iGaWv-3uia-70bjwPvfFGA.text: Honestly sushi in london has been average at best. This place is extremely overpriced for what you get. It was about 90GBP for two people and we weren't even full. It is one of those overhyped and overpriced places that happen to be all the rage for no good reason. i have to admit the cocktails looked pretty good but we had wine. i would be willing to come try the cocktails only. the food is totally nothing to write home about.

xdhGk0qe5kR82GzVrfsu4Q.text: Had a drink and a snack here. The views are amazing, well worth a look. Cocktails are pretty good, but expensive. Good service. However £22 for six small pieces of eel is just too much. Go and have a look at the view

q86ELWzzxij-PMdQQ-ctsg.text: Beautifully presented, great surroundings, knowledgable waiters and outstanding cocktails . Pricey? Yes . But worth it for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Samba london

2slQHSlasOpEqEZx6jUhtA.text: It's a fun place to go. Ambiance is absolutely gorgeous and food is delicious. We ordered lots of small plates like tempura and lots of sushi (nigiri). They were very good. Kobe Beef Ishiyaki $120 for 120g was entertaining - you cook thin slices of beef on a heated stone at table on your own - but it was SO NOT worth it. It was cut so thin that I couldn't taste "Kobe beef".Our server was a bit interesting but overall service was good.

06KIhRR8JCNCZB0O6SIu0w.text: I was confused, I thought that SushiSamba is an upscale dining not a night club!!I had a reservation at 11:30 pm for a dinner that was made by the concierge in my hotel. When I arrived, there was a bouncer and a long line outside the building in the cold weather!! when it was my turn, the bouncer ask me if I have a reservation and I told him yes. He opened his iPad and pretend that he was looking for my reservation then asked me who made my reservation, and when I answered him my hotel concierge he asked me didn't they told you about the dress code policy!! I told him no.. He was rude enough to tell me that my hotel should told me about the dress code for the restaurant and that my dress does not comply with the resturant requirements (I was wearing a sport shoes!!!) and he refused to let me in!! I came from the Savoy Fairmont which is considered an upscale hotel with the same dress that I use to dine in all of the upscale restaurants there and I was never refused the entrance. But in SushiSamba, A bouncer has the right to kick you out in a rude way and to waste your whole night. Customers are not important enough to have a resturant reception at the ground floor to greet and guide them. A bouncer outside the building is enough to humiliate customers and kick them despite the long drive and the difficulty in finding an appointment

D0b6UQr_KjF3MBzpwF1dwA.text: Visited the second time on my birthday, but gotta say not too satisfied with the service, which was quite slow. (The service attitude was good though.) Not sure if it's because the restaurant was too busy. But still more efficiency is needed. Food and atmosphere is still nice though.

IsOlNnSeFJK-x6fdELcJfg.text: London, as large of a city as it is, has an innumerable amount of restaurants to dine, celebrate, or grab drinks at. Sushisamba sets itself apart from the other eateries in service, quality, and height. Sipping a cocktail at the outside bar and dining in front of one of the most gorgeous city views was an experience to say the least. Fortunately, the originality and quality of Sushisamba's food was on par with the entertaining visual aspects of the restaurant. The seviche was made absolutely perfectly, the sushi exceeded my expectations, and although difficult to mess up, even the edamame was expertly salted. Lastly, the staff. Sushisamba's employees rose above and beyond what I had anticipated. Upon arrival you are met with an escort for the trip in the elevator. The man immediately greeted us with a warm welcome and proceeded to put a smile on our faces with his personality. Although rather chilly outside the bartender was in great spirits, clearly cold, but still joking and making small talk with other friendly patrons. Our server was lovely and her in depth knowledge in regards to the restaurant's food was very helpful. All in all I had a great experience at Sushisamba and would most definitely return. Also, don't let these reviews about the dress code scare you. I was not dressed to the 9s by any means and was treated with the same amount of respect by the staff as the guy in the full suit next to me.

T022t0k3vPzoxTgnnhikBg.text: My last visit to the 39th floor left me with one conclusion - come back on someone else's dime! Good cocktails, well-dressed peeps (esp my date and me obviously), and stunning views (seriously, the lift launches you up towards the skies and WOWser). But the drinks, and more so the sushi, were overpriced for the slow service and what we got.I've waited for an excuse to go back, so jumped at a work drinks event here last week. This time we hit the 38th floor outdoor terrace to catch the fleeting British summer. It faces north-east-ish (so go for a wander to see the City skyline on the other side) but I had fun trying to spot my flat out towards the Olympic Stadium!Got a taste of the high life on the VIP side of the velvet rope (eek) as our host was buying bottles, which entitles you to escape the rammed half of the bar and score some seats at the outdoor tables.Disappointing then that despite buying a magnum of champagne as we were such a big group, they seemed to try some cheeky upselling, telling our host that they'd run out of the first 2 Laurent Perrier bottles on the list and as such she'd have to go for the third most expensive magnum for £30 more. Lo and behold, after ordering a couple more they mysteriously found some LP after all. Hmm...She also got some bar food in with a haul of edamame bowls (can't really go wrong) and some samba rolls. These were a mega tasty twist on sushi that I hadn't had before - each piece carefully assembled with like ten different ingredients (think crab, salmon, prawn, wagyu, scallop, avocado and more, all in one). Only catch is for £12-16 per platter they each only had 6-8 rolls; now magic in your mouth or not, £2 per sushi piece felt kinda ridiculous.Given I wasn't paying(!) we had a fun eve from pinky sunset until the orange tree sculpture at the centre of the bar lit up in fairy lights and they turned on the gas fires to keep it cosy (it's breezier than you think 38 floors up!).Service still a little slow but can't resist the 4th star for how much I love that view and the lift ride up! I'll still wait for a special treat to go back - but now I also know to go for the rolls over the sashimi, and not to open the samba-music-playing website at work...

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. 38th floor outdoor bar

nUSJwSZQmEReDirx4E63tw.text: I finally got to test out Sushisamba and it was as good or even better than I had imagined. We went there without a reservation which I'm very well aware is a big no no, but we just thought we would try our luck and at least have some drinks in the bar and enjoy the view while we are at it. We went in on a Sunday evening around 7pm and there was still a line outside. So if you want to go there for dinner, be sure to make a reservation at least two weeks in advance! There is also a dress code so dress up people ;) Seriously you won't get in not looking the part. One of the best moments of the Sushisamba experience is definitely the glass elevator ride up to the 38th floor. The view is absolutely breathtaking on your way up.So we got in and put our names down on the waiting list and went to the bar. I ordered a Santazumi and later a Fukuko Cloud from their seasonal drink list; both a variation of my all time favourite drink the Whiskey Sour. They set you back 13 pounds a pop but believe me when I say it's well worth it! The first sip of the Santazumi was just perfection - one of the best drinks I've ever had in my entire life. The other drink was absolutely heavenly too and as it happens the bartender who had created the drink was serving that evening so I got to tell him personally how much I loved the drink. We got a table after waiting about an hour so not too bad. Unfortunately we couldn't get a table in the actual dining room but got a place at the bar which was perfectly fine considering we just walked in. We ordered green bean tempura with black truffle aioli for starters and it was divine. I haven't had tempura that good anywhere outside of Tokio. Amazing! For main we had the Samba London and Yoyogi rolls and the 7 pieces of Nigiri, and I have to say it was some of the best sushi I've ever had - if not the best. The ingredients were impeccable and so delicious I think I died and went to food heaven. The white wine we had was a perfect paring as well, nice acid and kind of tart at first but with the sushi it transformed into pure silk in your mouth. My experience at Sushisamba was nearly perfect but I do have to say that I wasn't completely happy with some aspects of the service. For example when we were seated to our table (or at the bar in this case) the waitress told us very bluntly that "here is your table, you have it for one hour!". I thought it was quite rude to be honest - especially the way she said it. Anyway we did get to eat in peace and nobody came to trough us out after an hour but that is still no way to talk to your customers. The cloak room girls and the bouncer downstairs were quite rude as well, but I guess this is the style of the restaurant. I just don't agree with it. I don't think there is any reason to treat your paying customers badly no matter how posh the restaurant is.That being said I'm still giving the restaurant 5 stars since I loved the view, the food, the drinks and the lovely bartenders! Sushi Samba is a must for everyone living in London at least once!

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Masters at work ;)
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. 7 pieces of Nigiris.
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom

dyQtwUPUDGBjFfkaEyh2wA.text: Well finally after over a months wait for my 12pm table it was finally time to see what all the hype has been about!Just a short walk from my office you arrive at the Heron Tower, which is impressive before you even step into the glass sided lift that whips you up to the 38th Floor. Since I'm not a fan of heights I remained front faces during the 30 sec odd ascent, but a brief glimpse showed me that it was a lovely view on the way up.You are greeted by a efficient lady and her clipboard, where they promptly assign you to someone else to take you to your seat. We were not lucky enough for a full window seat, but we did get seated next to the outside terrace so we had a bit of a view.The restaurant has very high ceilings bringing a massive feeling of space and the Asian/oriental style decor compliments the space.Next for the menu & food.... Menu is fairly compact, there are not endless choices which is a good thing especially with sushi are it can sometimes be overwhelming. My lunch date had been before so she recommended a couple of things to try and the other two dishes we just made a call; it's quite difficult to know what some of the items will actually be like, as the descriptions are a bit cryptic! The food we had was very good, excellent flavors and combinations of ingredients - perhaps the portions a tad on the small size but nothing that wasn't unexpected given the place and it being sushi after all. The only thing that was slightly annoying were the wait staff. I'm not sure if it's because they want to get you out quick to turn the table around; they don't have that many tables to attend or they have been trained to be super efficient, but they were constantly at our table - asking if we needed something else and clearing the plates away as soon as the last bite was in your mouth! Obviously the other thing is it's pretty pricey, but given the place, atmosphere and food it's worth a go. I would def like to go again for a special occasion, maybe try it at dinner time and in the summer to sit out on the lovely terrace.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Outside terrace lovely for summer
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. View from 38th floor
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Restaurant atmosphere at lunchtime

1fgpyxhitcAEhZHMRRHRPA.text: Amazing location with beautiful views of the city. Upon arrival, you are whisked up to one of the top floors via an elevator which to a club-like atmosphere. We booked our 11 pm reservation for two on a Wednesday weeks in advance. We didn't arrive until midnight (our flight from the US was delayed), but it was still packed. Our waitress was very helpful in walking up through the menu and giving suggestions, many of which we took. We started with the glazed pork belly crispy taquitos and got a series of large plates as well. The pork belly stood out as the best part of the meal, thought it was all impressive. Overall, I was most impressed with the location and the views it afforded!

Ywx6cSSr2xk_Q2VzhUVRJg.text: This place would be  five stars if not for the door man Dillmar. He was extremely rude and disrespectful. I had heard very good things about sushisamba from colleagues and being from LA. Was excited to try. We had a reservation booked but when getting to the door the doorman was rude and aggressive. A turn off all around. After some deliberation we decided to proceed with dining there but they really should have better representation at front door as the first impression was awful.

j65yZ-bdO_sG3pfDpl1WbQ.text: Wow! Great Peruvian and Asian fusion! We ate what our waiter recommended and it was all very delicious! From the shiitake mushroom filled miso soup to the scalloped ceviche... And then some ! Everything we ordered was pretty spot on! Not only is it bursting with flavor in your mouth but the presentation is art! The service these guys give is also top notch! We loved it so much we will be visiting  the one in Miami soon! Errol and Jason, two managers there, came to our table and were the most pleasant sweet people! And yes... Let's not forget the beautiful view you get of London while you eat!!

64y6dLAQkJb4cTEejoQCPg.text: okay! i have to type this in caps as it was probably the best sushi experience i had. i've been to ss in las vegas, and hope to dine at ss in ny and miami, but this place was phenominal! i savored every bite as it was the freshest tasting sushi i've ever had. i always have a great experience in service and food taste at the las vegas location, but maybe sushi tastes a little better when your 39 floors above see level with amazing view and a great restaurant vibe! this is definitely a bucket list "must add"!

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Tiger roll
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Sushi portion of menu

NFH2-zWT814jmEpchkqJTQ.text: Elegant atmosphere, a beautiful view but an anti-climatic meal.Food: *Atmosphere: ****Service: *****At the foot of Heron Tower in central London we're greeted by the concierge dressed in formal attire. After affirming our reservation for a 4pm afternoon snack he lets us on the elevator taking us to the 39th floor where SushiSamba resides. Already our expectations are high. We arrive early for our reservation and are offered an option to sit at the lounge area for drinks or head to our table. We get to our table, examine the menu and the view that we can't really admire due to their patio not being open. We become intrigued by a few of the dishes on the menu and end up with the Samba London and Seabass sashimi..The seabass  (SUZUKI USUZUKURI), tasted simple. A hint of Seabass and lime. Served COLD which isn't the best way to enjoy sashimi in my opinion. 13 GBP for 6 slivers.The SAMBA LONDON would have you believe it's probably the greatest item on their menu since it's named after the restaurant. It has crab, tuna, salmon, white fish, prawn, scallop, wagyu, avocado, tempura crunch, wasabi mayo, aji panca, house-made soy reduction at 16 GBP for 6 pieces. The quality of the rice was grocery store-esque. There was so many ingredients but the flavours weren't there. The tempura and mayo stood out the most. Rubbish.My date and I agreed on this review. I had no expectations about their food prior to going. This was a first hand experience. Disappointed and not worth the view.

Nl42N1mn6euGcDjO1yh11Q.text: First, I made a reservation well in advance and I would have assumed that the restaurant was packed, but no, almost empty.  Have no idea why they acted like it was so busy.  Server was awful.  Not attentive or helpful.  But worst of all, the restaurant was scorching hot for lunch.  Every patron was sweating and blowing air on themselves with the menu.  Turn your air conditioning on.  We're spending 200 dollars on lunch and you can't make people comfortable?

MKV4l70VsMOOjTyDvKhCFQ.text: 5-Star View3-Star Decor/Ambiance2-Star Cocktails (especially for the price)I am a bonafide rooftop/vista-oriented bar addict.  If there's a bar with a view in any of my travel destinations, better believe it's on my tentative itinerary.  The open-faced, ear-popping elevator ride is worth the trip to the 38th floor of Heron Tower alone; the view from above is simply unmatched.  Personally, the strong highlights of Sushisamba starts and ends at the panoramic views.  The drinks are pricey, as expected.  I came with 3 other friends, and I had the Smoked Plum Negroni (Hibiki whiskey, Aperol, sweet vermouth, and umeshu) for £13.  As a barhead, this was one of the most disappointing drinks I've tasted; I found the drink too watery (from all the ice stuffed in the glass) and too uneventful in taste.  I tasted my friend's cocktail, some sort of martini, and I wasn't greatly impressed with it either.  Thankfully, I was distracted by the good company around me and the breathtaking views on either side of the bar.  Music was good-ish, the crowd was nice enough and the glowing orange decor a bit too gaudy for my tastes.If you want the same incredible views with a better bar experience, I highly recommend Duck & Waffle bar upstairs (40th floor) instead.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom

GDiDmRHFerq-LxgvnPKFQw.text: Visited for birthday drinks, really wanted to have dinner but apparently you need reservations a month in advance for big groups, so fyi. The view did not disappoint and the ride up the glass escalator was worth it. Actually two of my friends were starving and were able to score a small table on the spot.  There's nowhere to sit really so don't wear your 5 inch heels and it took us ages to get drinks. The all female bartenders kept passing up us ladies for the handsome men, can't blame them. However, once I complained and said it was my birthday they made me this delicious fruity drink on the house so it kind of made up for it. I'd love to come back soon with a smaller group to eat and next time will send one of the guys to secure drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. View is always better from the top!
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Orange tree

nt5Wwp4IdYyti0zRM5z7Lw.text: Spectacular view and decent food. There're a handful of AMAZING Japanese restaurants in London. I don't think SUSHI SAMBA stands out from the crowd in terms of their food. But it's more about an experience anyway. It is slightly overhyped but definitely worth visiting, especially for tourists. I would recommend to book a window table at night : D

W7BEk0_nsqTII3wvuX_l9A.text: I ate at Sushi Samba when it was near empty on a Tuesday at noon. It was definitely a great way to enjoy the ambiance and space, enjoy the view, as well as to chat with the staff. Taste-wise, I absolutely enjoyed my dishes. No complaints. I ordered the crispy wagyu crispy taquitos to start, its meaty filling w the avocado and mayo was surprisingly light and perfect as a starter. Flavourful, creamy, and slightly sweet. Next I had the Sao Paulo samba roll, a scrumptious mix of scallop, masago, red onion, tuna, salmon, shrimp, white fish, avocado, truffle, hatcho miso soy, chive oil (yes all in one roll). Utterly delicious. Surprisingly the black truffle paired very well with the avocado and seafood. Overall a flavourful main perfect for sharing and very filling. Will definitely be back! I hear they make a delicious banana & miso dessert item...

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Sao Paolo samba roll
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Wagyu crispy taquitos

qe6uTac9tznl8X_KDy0c6w.text: The view is super good, if it is your first time in london, do pop in. The appetizers for me were the best part

3drL5cYuSnmVlum3t2fx-A.text: The lift up to Sushi Samba on the top floors of the Heron tower is quite an experience as it shoots upwards above the office buildings and the whole city of London comes into view from above. Some surprisingly narrow corridors connect from the lift to the restaurant. First a bar area with sushi counter plus large outdoor terrace with a big tree in the centre. Another few paces around the corner takes you to the  restaurant proper which is quite light and airy with another outside terrace. The view is amazing.I've been to Sushi Samba in New York  several times and it was one of my favourite places to eat there so was interested to try the London location. Not as easy to get a reservation in London vs. NYC where we had just been able to walk in if early enough in the evening but I think it's more of a destination restaurant here with the high up location. The early evening crowd was a mix, youngish with money to flaunt, some people in for the occasion.We were seated right away and ordered. We sampled the rock shrimp tempura, the asparagus and flank steak with Peruvian corn and also the calamari with plantain. These were 'small plates' as almost everything seems to be now but actually varied in size from the shrimp and calamari (largish portions) to the steak (small). The shrimp tempura was good but a bit heavy with the mayo dressing which detracted from the crispiness. Calamari was good and the flank steak was OK but not too exciting.Our small group ordered 4 different samba rolls. Visually very pretty (see pic) and nicely arranged on a large platter. Overall pretty good with some interesting  combinations and textures. We all enjoyed the rolls but maybe a little too much going on. Heavy on salty flavours and a bit too much mayo toppings. Quite fun to eat but don't order too many like we did. I know it's a fusion concept and not Japanese sushi but busier, bolder, saltier and heavier. I like the taste and texture combinations but we started to wonder if it really had that super freshness of the fish which is critical since it was masked by everything else. We needed more picked ginger to counteract everything else. The wasabi was nice, coarse and not fiery as usual. Maybe this was real wasabi and not the intense green horseradish/ mustard combo which I think I am used to?They do have 'regular' nigiri and sashimi on the menu so maybe a good choice to have one or two rolls and some more standard sushi alongside.Service was polite and efficient. Cost was around £55 / head so not cheap. Good and interesting dishes but not quite as good as the NYC W. Village branch which was also better value. I'd come back to bring visitors for a fun dinner but not especially for the food alone.I veer between 3 - 3.5 stars based on the food / value but overall 4 stars for the whole experience.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. A selection of sushi samba rolls
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. The view!

qSkEO_HnM7mrfkKXY8JfNw.text: Sushi Samba is a great place for drinks, and the food is good if you don't insist on the Sushi side of things. First about drinks. The restaurant is located on the 38th and 39th floors of Heron Tower and has a wonderful view of the city. There is an outdoor patio bar on the 38th floor and it is definitely THE place to be on a nice evening. There is a huge fake tree covered in orange lights inside the round bar area. It is quite impressive and makes for an awesome background for photos. You can actually see it from afar at street level. Inside there are some spiral stairs connecting the two levels and there, you will have the best head on view of The Gherkin. You can hardly walk up or down these stairs without tripping over people taking photos or selfies. Since it is close to the city, you get a lot of suit and tie type here. And girls tend to be over dressed, especially on weekends. However, it is a great spot to come for a drink and admire the city. I often take my out of town guests here.The food. I had to try a few time to finally make a reservation here for dinner. The dining room was lovely with many light bulbs directly hanging from the ceiling. It feels like that you are dining under the stars. The food is Brazilian and Japanese fusion, as the name suggests. My friend and I started our meal with some sushi rolls. Interesting combination, but it was OK. The Steak, foie gras and quail egg, however, was outstanding. That was the first time my friend ever tried foie gras and she was hooked. She still talks about that dish after over 6 months. We then had the seafood mixed rice, which is a typical Brazilian dish. It was delicious, but we wish there were a bit more of it. Overall, I think it is good, but it is a over-priced.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Seafood mixed rice
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Steak, foie gras and quail egg
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Sushi

Ia53CxzZNPJVa60YCNC-UQ.text: Similar to Duck & Waffle (literally above) ...it's all about the location, rather than the food.It's fine, and dandy at what it does: leaving do's, birthday parties, any fairly loud gathering you want to glam-up by going somewhere a bit different.Probably not for date night, having a conversation or if you have a hangover.The cuisine is fun, but they serve a large number of people, and turn the tables over as fast as they can - and that shows! Not for foodies

bA6j-hPxuP71_6uyNi0H2g.text: Stopped in there to see the place after duck and waffle. I want to come back and get a full meal. Be ready to spend some cash and get great sushi.

G0pCJohgMW6ZG3rZUMFhpA.text: I went to Sushi Samba for my birthday and it was amazing. The room itself is something of a wonder, with hanging lights and views looking out above London with the city lights twinkling below, it really was beautiful. There were plenty of staff who were all attentive which made for a nice effort. The cocktails are delicious, although make sure you try more than one! There is an abundance of choice when it comes to food so choose wisely! The presentation of the food is immaculate and the taste of the sushi was impeccable. I cannot fault anything with the food in sushi samba and would definitely go back again. The only thing that gave me a little bit of a shock was the bill at the end, but I guess you get what you're paying for, so I wouldn't go again unless it was for another occasion where you can go all out.

rD7SWPUKFtX5zCvN5pL1nQ.text: Hands down the best sushi I've ever had. It's not cheap, but the price is totally worth it for a special occasion. The service is impeccable, each waiter only mans about 5 tables so has lots of time to assist you with ordering and give you lots of attention. The view is one of the best in London, with a 360 sight of London. The dessert was like something you'd see on Master Chef. I went at 10PM on a Sunday night, and from the atmosphere, it could have been a friday, it was buzzing. Would 100% go back.

kc0S4E9DHS-eWkfJeJyCwg.text: This sushi samba is amazing! The one in South Beach, Miami, FL has a great location too but the London sushi samba is something else! The service is ten times better, the view breathtaking! The decor of the place is amazing! Everything flows super smoothly there. Great experience every time I go to London! BUT I had to knock one star off because your wasabi (just like the one in Miami) sucks. Simple like that. How can you mess up the wasabi? Feels like u add too much salt to it? Idk :/

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Amazing view great staff beautiful place!

RqLpyMlR1EugV_iqGe0WCQ.text: I was trying to book online when I read that I need to book two months in advance to go eat at Sushi Samba!!! Any way I wanted a late lunch and was able to book a table for 3 pm on the same day! Walking out of the lift, the same cold smile that you get at similar restaurants in London We were offer to choose where we wanted to be seated and we chose the indoor space which was pretty empty. The waiters were attentive and friendly, tried to sway us from ordering too many plates but my sister and I were keen to try as many variations as possibleThe food was good- pricy The outdoor terrace is amazing - will go back again to spend time on the terrace

OsZCQsEN3XIvjS6XXD8Afw.text: Oh yes. It's really this good. Talked our way in with the bouncer with no reservation (score!). Then enjoyed the most delicious melt in your mouth sushi. With each bite we were closing our eyes and ...ooh, yes. Order their signature roll, it's their signature for a reason. Complete aphrodisiac.

tZQg7ZDmTpT4-UJlEwi8-g.text: Had to come here because of the hype. The place had lovely decor, good service and food was nice. But have to say portions were very small considering what we finally had to pay at the end. A nice experience.

_Uh1jOMimdUDgwoVuKH-ag.text: Been here a couple times for drinks and once for a meal. Food is average, but the wow factor is the view from the 39th floor.My experience with the bouncers downstairs at Heron Tower is that they're just there for crowd control (wait, I guess like typical bouncers). They may not let you in if you state that you don't have a reservation, or tell you to call some random phone number. If you state that you do have a reservation, however, they have no way of verifying it and just let you up.The lounge area is a nice place to hang out and bringing out-of-towners to see the amazing view from the giant windows. The lounge is also open quite late, so a good place to head to if you're finishing a late dinner somewhere and want to head out for drinks without being bothered to move twice.The food is pretty standard for showy "fusion" Japanese (think: Roka, Zuma, Aqua Kyoto) with South American influences. Pricey and nothing very memorable. I've eaten at the Sushi Samba at Park Ave in NY and thought the same. The focus if you're coming here, though, is not the food, but the ambiance. A good place to impress guests/clients from out of town.

xBko_tfuXhseu5DDV_5n4Q.text: Four stars for the lift, the views and the terrace. Three stars for the staff - although, to be fair, they do have to deal with more than their fair share of half-wits. Two stars for the price - ouch!Things have been tidied up recently - as the facilities were starting to look like they had received the foot-fall of the the cast of Ben Hur on a daily basis (which they probably do). There is very little seating inside - probably to discourage the tourists (which doesn't work), and you'll need to avoid the rush hours (lunchtime and 15:45 on) to be in with a chance of sitting outside. The outdoor terrace faces the wrong way - North, but the inside view South and South-West is stunning ....... until they put a couple more sky-scrapers around Heron Tower.

vPnuTVYiHwgry8uw-ijW0w.text: There are 2 things (amongst many) that I adore in life: amazing views, and sushi. I must admit that my better half did a very good combo when booking a table at Sushi Samba for our anniversary - however reading the reviews here, I got a bit scared.So yeah, it is in the higher price range (150£ for 2 based on 7 dishes, 2 wine glasses and 2 cocktails), and is definitely a hype place full of people speaking Russian with a bit of bling and shiny jewelry. But... we kind of expected that, right?Globally, our experience at Sushi Samba was amazing, and the wow effect starts as soon as you shoot up to the 38th floor while having a view over the City. The decoration fits what it says on the tin: a weird mix between Asian and South American with an orange tang to it all. Service was what one could expect in these kind of restaurants - maybe a wee over serviced to my taste.But the most important in all that is that... OMG THE FOOD WAS AMAZING!Dishes are bold, exotic and a bit extravagant. The products are extremely fresh, tasty and set up with some surprising associations, such as sushi on a bed of pumpkin mousse, mozzarella with salmon on rolls. A bit on the small side, but that also encourages you to take the time and really enjoy the various flavours you get.Desert on my end (cheesecake) was a bit of a disappointment compared to the main dishes, so just try something else - or just skip the desert and treat yourself to a sake :)So in a nutshell - go there to impress, or for a culinary experienceThe positives;- The setting - dinner on the 38th floor definitely has a wow effect- The dishes. Just for the food itself. Sushi samba was worth the experience.- The company, but that doesn't really count in a Yelp reviewThe less positives:- I can't take a point down for the posh/snobby side - as that is what one would expect. However it lacked a bit of cosiness and felt a bit cold.- The cocktails were a bit on the mean side for the price, and the desert was a bit bland even if it looked impressive.I will definitely go back, and focus the budget on the main courses. And probably over the summer to have a closer look at the view :)

MIpicXWGTIy15_lOhoQcSA.text: Outstanding!!! The best sushi ever and amazing ambiance ! On the 36th floor overlooking London! Awesome City views! Excellent views of the Gherkin! The decor is modern and hip attracting people who love swag! Had exotic cocktails and amazing sushi dinner. This is one place to put on your list to experience!

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Very special night!
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Outside bar!
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Cheers to a fabulous time!

xwVyyhT9_G-pYSdGL2fVfA.text: I booked a table for dinner for my posse to celebrate anyone with a birthday in Oct. Be advised that SusiSamba London books up fast and well in advance, so don't think about rocking up unannounced.The rocket speed, near 360 elevator gets you up to SushiSamba in style - check out the views as you go whizzing up which get you all excited for the beautifully decorated and spacious space of the SushiSamba bar.We had various items from the menu, all of which got big chopsticks up! My favs were the Wagyu Gyoza and Rock Tempura Shrimp. The Tonk Bean Cocktail is sneakily lethal but oh, so delicious. The service was good and the wait staff helpful.Be sure to make a booking and visit the outside patio (if it's warm enough). This place is tops on my London list.

YCDUSF6OxWPPxfxO93ot7A.text: Spectacular view, great food. Second time here, I find the staff very attentive and quick.. No trace of slow or unfriendly service. I agree that the ambience and atmosphere is very elite.. Which is reflected in the price.Still a very nice place - especially if you want to impress someone special ;)

zU4NCrwZTAIeqSQUyqd3Sg.text: Absolutely amazing food and service. Couldn't have asked for anything better. Got there around 1030 pm and they were completely full. The staff created a space for us and several others to sit and eat. We had the full menu options and the entire staff was very helpful.

LcWlgnTgT4BH44qAf7HZaw.text: Fantastico!Was recommended by Yelpers Connie M. and Yee Gan O. and it was all hit - no miss!First of all, you're in awe by the huge building that is the Herron Tower. A sexy glass elevator takes you 38 flights above to SushiSamba which is a restauraunt that served food influenced by the Japanese, Peruvian and Brazillian cultures. The three influences are reflected in everything from food, to cocktails and even the music. The food is absolutely and beautifully well done! Everything is meant to be shared, but you'll find yourself reluctant to let your dinner mates share anything as the food is absolutely divine! Try it all and don't be shy - it's worth it!The swanky decor just makes you feel so pretty. (It really does.) Go here to enjoy delicious cocktails upstairs, on the balcony or for dinner in the main room. Easily my new favourite in London!*samba dances away*

FhVbMPgVdmKHFr5Nj8GEsQ.text: Very pretty, great sushi, great waitresses! Well worth a visit to view the city of London. Don't ask why, but the view of the city from the women's bathroom was phenomenal! Haha

c6CDPXUAopkpsghrbpSMIw.text: Great views.  Make reservations in advance.  Nice place for a date on a summer evening.

RVj3U5Sd7vLkPny-E-aBag.text: Awesome location on the 37th floor.  Amazing venue to entertain clients.  Book well in advance.Enjoyed drinks on the outside terrace overlooking the city before sitting down to dinner.  Set menu for 15 people, food was excellent, well prepared and tasted great.The service could have been a little better considering the size of our party but a fantastic venue and fantastic food.  Highly recommended.

ubtoj-ZXJFUtxbQh0_toQw.text: Fantastic Cocktail,Amazing Views.Great Bar,but sadly the food is average and seriously overpriced.If your looking to take a date,on a clear sunny day in London,there really isn't anywhere with better views or ambiance.My hot food dishes came out in all different temperatures.

xPGOK-r6oby40a3vFDlNHQ.text: This place is so fancy that it won't even let you wear flip flops. Like you aren't bare footed so it should be fine. If there was a no star u would give it that. Very disappointed and I came from a really far distance to try it. The main reason was just to go up the elevator to see the building and city. The guy didn't even let us go up. Highly disappointed.

fS3PTI5k4uz2f2Dr27Exmw.text: Where do you go when you fancy cocktails and a nice dinner with a view? Heron Tower is an easy option in London, and Sushi Samba perfect when you can get a table!the barWe started with cocktails at the bar. Unlike those upstairs in Duck and Waffle I thought they were more hit and miss. My Japanese twist on a negroni, using the plum sake umeshu was pleasant, however some of the other cocktails were too sweet. Perhaps the barman on that evening had a sweet tooth? Anyway we were really here for the food!dinnerThe dining room was a lovely space allowing you see out across London 270 degrees (the kitchen was on the last side). But it did feel a little tight when the tables started filling up. We had a booth at the side of the restaurant, which are obviously the best!We went for a mixture of small and large plates from across the menu. A gimmick to get to you buy more or playing to those like me who like to try everything? The jury is out on that one, but I enjoyed eating my way through most sections of the menu.The shrimp tempura (which looks like a salad) was very nice, with a spicy truffle dressing complementing it. The roll however was not great texture or flavour. I think this was the California maki, but I can't recall, not great when I was that ordered it.The ceviche came with pickled mandarin and mandarin leche de tigre and shiso. Showcasing the restaurants' ability to mix up the traditional from both the Japanese and South American sides of the menu.Mixed feelings on the wagyu gyoza with kabocha puree and probably some truffle (they use truffle oil liberally in here!) These are truffly versatile! I like truffle so the liberal use on most dishes went down a treat with me. Some of my friends weren't so keen. I do believe that truffles should only be used sparingly, where they complement the food in season (i.e. only in Winter!). In this case the gyoza were very tasty, but I don't think they showcase the Wagyu particularly.The samba salad was beautifully presented, but you need to mix it all together to get the flavour combinations. Again this is served with a truffle ponzu dressing, but felt super healthy even with that decadence!Black cod miso was a classic that we had to try. The fish was perfectly cooked and went well with the corn it was served with. Another South American ingredient showcased with the traditional Japanese.The vegetable tempura were great, as long as you like a punch of garlic flavour from the sauce. I loved it!Now for me, the mushroom tobanyaki was the star of the show. Who says the vegetarians don't get any fun? This mushroom dish was rich, seasonal and succulent. The truffle flavour was present again here, but with the richness of 3 different types of mushroom and the just poached egg to stir in, it was sublime. Definitely my winning dish for a Winter's dinner!The grilled poussin with a teriyaki glaze and served with the best Japanese mayonnaise was very tasty (but not a patch on the mushrooms obvs).Trying to be healthy we ordered the aubergine too. You can't go wrong with grilled aubergine - one of my favourite vegetables - but this was slightly upstaged by the mushrooms.By now I didn't need a dessert, but I wanted to try them out....dessertsI had the With Love from Rio - with that name I had no idea what this dessert would be! Turns out that this was valhrhona chocolate ganache (single source from Brazil naturally!), coffee mousse and tonka bean ice cream. The mousse was dehyrdated (it's the stuff that looks like snow!)My friend had the ice cream mochi - mochi are always good! Would you believe that I only tried these for the first time in Dusseldorf of all places?! and the  Alfajores - deconstructed obviously, but a great interpretation, my friend (from Argentina) gave it a big thumbs up!verdict: Come here for the views, stay for the food, not the cocktails!! A bottle of decent sake was £65 - which went around the five of us nicely, so there are other drink options!

Kopkg_pPMm5-rcPBKDOW3w.text: Food and drinks were delicious. The view was amazing while eating dinner. Would recommend this place. The only negative experience was the one of the hostess was very rude to my friend and I we noticed people taking photos outside on one of the roof areas next to where  we ate. After dinner we asked one of the hostess if we could go out there when we were leaving she was condescending and said you need to be escorted out and it's for reservations and asked if we understood what she said. I replied we did have  reservations and just finished eating.   I don't understand why others were allowed out taking pictures and walking around when we had reservations  too. We finally made it out but the experience was ruined. Would give five stars but because of her it was ruined.

2MoRgnlRlK-u0E6U6vCiZw.text: The interior is nice, and the terrace is even better. The Japanese and Brazilian cuisine is a nice combination. The staff warm welcoming and greeting upon arriving and leaving the place is still ringing in my ears. I think this place looks & feels so different at night with their dim light.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. 3 different kinds of meats.  Churrasco Rio Grande.
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Kobe Burger/slider.

GL-acHFNuVrkudx7yoSTUw.text: Friends and I went after we waited for two months for our reservation date to come around. And it was worth every bit of the wait! First, the food was AMAZING. We got yellowtail sashimi with jalapeño, mixed ceviche, Sao Paolo and Sky Tree (name?) rolls, cod skewers with miso sauce and a large plate of various seafood with rice. My particular favourite was the Sao Paolo rolls -- they had chunky portions of fresh sushi with the perfect pinch of truffles to make it the best set of rolls I had ever had. Also great were the yellowtail sashimi (so fresh and flavourfully spicy!) and the cod skewers (very tender and perfectly seasoned). Drinks were great as well. I loved both of my cocktails and would go back just for them as well! Second, service was phenomenal. They came to check up on us every 10-15mins, and they were just delightful waiters with great recommendations to share and top notch promptness in bringing out the dishes. Finally, the ambience is posh and modern as well. Loved the lighting and every bit of decoration. We had our final round of drinks outside with the view, and it was great even in the cold weather. Perfect place for all sorts of occasions.

cOm-KJC2kuHc5UC7uDxK_w.text: Hands down one of the BEST dinners of my life paired with one of the best views of London's cityscape. How cool is that dizzying elevator ride up, amiright?? Started with the pork belly (which was SO tender and juicy) and the toro tiradito. Shared the Sao Paulo roll. It was my first time trying sushi with truffle oil and you better believe I am a fan. Finished with the With Love from Rio dessert. Smoked plum negronis all day.

beWmjkP9Mzo-wzn3AS6mcg.text: The place is fancy with a great atmosphere. It is located on the 21st floor therefore the view from is absolutely amazing. Reservations are a must! and I advice you to be there before time because we had a small problem regarding the timing but they managed it at the end. What I really recommend are the samba rolls, they are absolutely delicious!

4Gs-uQf1xGJudpane5lbRQ.text: I loved my experience here. The service was excellent, the food was amazing, and the VIEW was breathtaking!The entire experience is pretty cool, even beginning at the lift... Which moves surprisingly fast. The decor is trendy but really beautiful.I would highly recommend the pork ribs, Sao Paolo roll, and shrimp tempura. I was  still thinking about the ribs the day after... They were THAT good. I wasn't too impressed by the ceviche so maybe skip it and order another portion of ribs. :)Sushi Samba is pricey but it's definitely worth it for a special occasion. I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Pork ribs with barbecue miso. Amazing!
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Sao Paolo (L) and El Topi (R)... The Sao Paolo was out of this world!

xaSBWE5ybXcyu9xFhRoPpw.text: Very high profile restaurants carry very high expectations. Sushi Samba certainly exceeds many of those expectations, it is one of the most enjoyable evenings I've had in London. The wonderful staff is extremely well organized and they were able to accommodate me despite being 45 mins late for my reservation. The experience of dining at this place is hard to match, thanks in big part to stunning views of London.  Food, on the other hand...well, I've already forgiven them the fact that it is not the best sushi I've had in my life. Then again - it really doesn't matter. You don't go to sushi samba for sushi. You go for the experience.

kkD_j6KghPtBPumrJ1q1HQ.text: My husband and I had to check this out as it's received so much hype!  We went on a Friday evening at 6:00  The decor is just amazing.  Twinkling lights, Asian vibes, beautiful tables and chairs, plus an amazing outdoor patio with a HUGE orange twinkling tree! I mean - could it get any better?Oh yes it can! The food!  We started with the SHRIMP TEMPURA which ended up being our favourite.  It was PERFECTLY crispy and the sauce was exploding with flavour.  It was the perfect start!  Then we had the most interesting thing I think either of us have ever eaten...CORAZON DE POLLO which we found out meant chicken heart skewers.  They had the texture of a little sausage and a very smoky flavour.  I didn't hate them, but the little artery in the heart was a little hard for me to get over.  Let's just say I only ate a few!  !  Then we had the sushi!  We had 2 different ones:  TOKYO SKY TREE & TIGER MAKI.  Both were fantastic!  The fish was so fresh and the sauces were so flavourful! It was awesome.  We each had a glass of saki to compliment our meal!Overall - great.  Save it for a special occasion.  It's EXPENSIVE.  I'd prefer to have a meal at Duck + Waffle and do drinks at SushiSamba in the future!

VTx11QETizqTU57R985axw.text: Over priced, over rated.  If you just want to enjoy the view, just go up for drinks to the 39th floor (no reservations required).  Service is ok.  Reservations strongly recommended for dinner though.
