PT7hdlAUBUeKDTW2bl97aQ.text: I'm sorry, I just love this place. I know I know it's full of tourists and perhaps some odd Londoners as well, but for a fine dinner and even just drinks at the bar it's a cool spot in the city. We've over done the sake and tuna belly too many times and we will always come back for more. Great vibes even without the sky scraper views.

qik620p4c4OKGWj6xiRmzw.text: As far as food goes and views, this place is five stars. Service however? Extremely lackluster. We came in this evening, a group of seven, and were seated near the bar on a couch, which was fine considering we were last minute but the entire sushi bar was open...and large enough for our entire party. When I requested it, they said no, there was another party to take it, it was empty the entire time. Each of us got a roll of some sort and a cocktail. My roll was I believe the Tokyo Sky roll, which was delicious. I tried the chucomber cocktail as well as the Nina Fresa, both were refreshing. The mango cocktail looked amazing.My issue here is with our service, it was non existent. We had a waiter who didn't necessarily seem busy, took two of our orders and then walked away for thirty minutes and left the other people in our party not served.  She came back, and they ordered, but it had to be 20 minutes later. We got our food from a food runner, which did look amazing, we waited a bit as it had been 35 minutes and our cocktails hadn't arrived, asked about our cocktails, got attitude from our server, then decided to just begin eating, we finished our food and ten minutes later she said she was sorry and that she didn't put our cocktails in yet. Needless to say, they finally came twenty minutes after the food was already eaten. She came back and took another two orders which she didn't seem thrilled about, and finally everyone just started ordering at the bar, because she took off on a break (for 20 minutes) without having a relief take over or even a warning.Then came the tab, that had the service charge, we paid it, but honestly there was hardly any service besides the food runners and the sushi chefs. The cocktails and food were delicious, but you had to work to get any type of service when it was a Monday night. This is in a beautiful establishment, one would think service would be exceptional but it just wasn't there.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Pretty tree on patio

9_kpEJOzt9wrXU_jM8J0jg.text: This place is nice but not great. I enjoyed the sashimi and the Kobe beef. I got the yogogi roll which, in my opinion was way over seasoned with salt. I expected a more upscale experience but it felt sub-par to other sushi restaurants I've been to. Our waitress was nice. We tried to enjoy the patio and take out desert out there, but we weren't allowed to because there was no service out there. That was upsetting because we saw people out there with coffee and drinks. We were willing to be served at our table and bring the dessert out there ourselves. Why do you have a beautiful patio with a gorgeous view and not use it? The Mochi ice cream was really good though! Experience was good, but feels more like a tourist stop rather than an luxury food experience.

6WbZs9C6QfBQxcn04XAdPw.text: The decor is top notch but dining room is super loud. Went in for a casual dinner with friends. No issue entering with our smart causal dress code. Food wise nothing knocked me out of the park. The black cod was amazing though. Kobi side burgers I also enjoyed. Sushi that we got was not superb. The rice is a bit mushy and overdone. I have the sat food came so slow and not in a seasonable order at all. The appetizer side burgers came last while they serve sushi and then the cod and other entrees? Were we just too casual? Well, we paid the same price and gratuity! Anyway overall disappointed but can see how the scenery attracts a crowd. Can be good for dates and more formal occasions

aNYxCQ_FG_AXubitgd_vQA.text: I was pumped to visit this place knowing its premium location and reputation. I was lucky enough to visit for my birthday celebration on my first visit and really didn't find any of the food to be outstanding let alone memorable. Furthermore, drink prices given its location in the Heron Tower are astronomical. I do like the outside bar area but the views from SushiSamba are not all great on the inside unless you are lucky with seating. For the views, it is lovely but the thrill of the dizzying elevator ride was more enjoyable than the food and service I've unfortunately experienced.On my second visit, I just popped by for drinks but found the crowd to be way too formal for my liking. I've visited Sushisamba in the states and much prefer it there. It began as a simple restaurant serving amazing food but unfortunately it parades itself around as a largely overpriced, pretentious restaurant in a prime location near Liverpool Street in London just because it can. Avoid, and go somewhere else where snooty service, tiny portions and insane prices don't overshadow the food served. If you must go for whatever reason, pop in for drinks (look for a big orange tree looking thing for the outdoor area) instead so you can check out the skyline without the disappointing food and quick table turnaround times.

EscBzba6La0dqxeWzUV_gQ.text: Ok sushi place with extremely high prices. Staff are very friendly and professional. So you are paying for the view...

b_qzkZvoLN0jcEBKEv8Q5g.text: Make sure to make reservations in London, most of the popular places book up so quickly. This place definitely was better than any sushi samba I've been to in the states. Gorgeous decor and the view of the gherkin/city was nice. The sushi was pricey but it was delicious. Plus our server was super attentive and accommodating.

dMuwAJm3vhKerlRncjnmYw.text: My boyfriend and I decided to visit Sushisamba for our year anniversary and it was definitely worth the wait! We got there and as we were early, we decided to have a cocktail at the bar. It was a Saturday night so they were busy however the cocktails were great. After waiting in the bar for around half an hour, we were led to our table which was by the window so we had a beautiful view of the city all lit up. They recommend around 5-6 dishes to share between two people. So we ordered the Edamame, Kuromitsu Glazed Pork Belly, Black Cod, Sea Bass Tempura, Samba London sushi rolls, El Topo sushi rolls. I'm not a big fan of pork but my other half is, however we compromised with me getting the sea bass tempura which he isn't a fan of. The pork however was delicious as was the black cod but the best dish by far was the El Topo sushi. This sushi is a fusion of Japanese and South American, putting jalapeños, salmon and mozzarella in a sushi roll. Just divine! Sushisamba is one of my favourites restaurants in London however definitely somewhere you would go to celebrate a special occasion in my opinion.

cz5tWxbWgGq-XvActEMuLQ.text: My husband and I celebrated our one year anniversary here! After reading lots of reviews they all recommended reservations and definitely more than the night of. We called hoping for the best but as expected, they could not accommodate us in the main dining room. They said since it was a Sunday evening though that we could take our chances at the sushi bar and eat dinner there. Upon our arrival we checked in with the greeter and she said we were in luck - there were only two open spots at the sushi bar!The ambiance:It was very busy despite it being a Sunday evening. Lots of people standing and enjoying cocktails as well as having dinner at the sushi bar. It was raining and the wind was blowing so sadly they closed the patio. We weren't able to go out there and see the city or get any photos. It was definitely a bummer but for the safety of their guests so I do understand why they closed it.The service:We had two servers all evening and they were both wonderful. They made recommendations of both food and beverage for us. Their saki sommelier even came over and assisted us with specific saki types that complimented our food! This really helped make the experience a  glowing one!The food:Since it was our anniversary we did NOT hold back. We ordered plantains, tuna seviche, a sasa hand roll, 2 carnival maki rolls, 2 orders of sake sashimi, and 1 order of chef's choice shashimi. It was all absolutely phenomenal. Seriously, that's why we kept ordering more - it was THAT good!Overall, we would highly recommend Sushisamba to anyone celebrating a special occasion or looking to drop a ton of cash in one evening. The service is outstanding, the product is spectacular and the views are fabulous!

AqVL1eH2ajoj84yl8rEO8Q.text: A stunning view from the 39th floorI recommend : Lobster tacos , shrimps tempura and poussin teriyaki all:()sushi rolls: tiger maki and eltop

aURqX9ycLBF25Cyu1QYOnw.text: Great place to have dinner and drinks in London great view nice environment cool service love the sushi !

3NkkMY548toSI1jaH0r9pQ.text: Honestly if you're not here for the food, then please do come here for the views! They're amazingly epic! and rivals the shard and sky gardens. and you do kinda get same-ish views on landmarks like the Gherkin. In terms of views, you dont get the same scope but at night, it really is terrific and an experience in itself. Upon entering the floor of Sushisamba, it felt like walking through a really trendy Japanese bar :D Best of all, entry was free with security checks along the way. To get here, you'll be whizzed up on a super fast elevator (abit, well alot like Charlie and the Chocolate Factory glass elevator!!) The loos were amazing! Very japanesy!!! One day, when i'm rich, I'll eat at the sushi bar :D

TAZjfOndpWS3jrAuLiaw0Q.text: Sushi samba has never failed to disappoint and I believe that their London location is the best due to their amazing food, service and atmosphere. The management of this restaurant turned a good lunch into an amazing lunch. When there was a delay with some of our food the manager, Pablo Palomino, noticed right away. He not only apologized and comp'd what were waiting on, but built a genuine relationship with us in the process. We were already happy with our meal, but left ecstatic over the great service.

nnVfZuTT4DYaCp6LM0d_2w.text: Some of the best sushi that I've had in London. Also great views. We walked in without a reservation and were told we could order a drink and wait in the patio area. We ordered a really fun cocktail (although a little pricey at around £15) and only had to wait on the patio for about 20 minutes. It was just two of us, so they had some availability at the bar. We ate there. They had a baked mozzarella sushi roll that was amazing and we ordered another cocktail because they were so fun. Definitely worth the experience and the view. Highly recommend.

5-Iqe0uuu0NpRNIZR4B7-w.text: Lovely, sophisticated atmosphere with delicious cocktails and sushi. I went here for my birthday and enjoyed sitting outside with the priceless view. The prices are a bit steep, but it's worth the experience.

KoJrIFb-GTzYB90WJ958ig.text: If you are looking for excellent quality fish expertly made into sushi along with respectful service and an elegant atmosphere do NOT come here. This place doesn't not focus on food or show any attention to detail. This is a more of a "pick-up joint / look at me / first date in high building with a view" place - which might distract some from the bad food. Worst sushi I have had in London.

Wl0flHLstUbaWe9ysxu-Kw.text: I always love going here. Sushi samba has a great vibe, the setting is spectacular and it's one of my favourite places in London to take friends from overseas or just enjoy a great dining experience. I'd say the food is definitely up there - Brazilian Peruvian and Japanese fusion. My favourite is the São Paulo sushi rolls - truffle on sushi?!? Yes please! The staff are fantastic, the setting is great. The food looks like pieces of art! What's not to like?

Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Deserts are a treat

JISMetrdFH9M9ZmALodHdQ.text: On holiday and came to this sushi bar.  Service and ambiance is amazing.  Not to mention the view from the 40th floor.  I did have an issue with one of the drinks and mentioned it to Francesco.  Without hesitance he understood and provided us with complimentary bar food.  Now that is great attention!  Recommend this place 100%.  Thanks to everyone for the fine attention and service.

KQnwxBYIn1oB9VCn900ALg.text: Terrible service at the bar, since we got there we basically had to beg for service and food! The place is nice and the restaurant looks nice but the bar doesn't worth the visit, it is a shame I will never find out about the service in the restaurant since I have no intentions to go to this place again having so many wonderful restaurant options in London!

rkNO4nuFXCczRB4lZ3CqCg.text: Ok.  I'll start from the beginning.  We arrive to be greeted by a doorman at the  ground floor.  He informs us there is a dress code and that we weren't "up to code" but that he would make an exception if we took our hats off--no problem. Nice since our luggage didn't arrive and we didn't have a change of clothes. This is where the experience went south.  Once we arrive up at the restaurant (38th floor) and approach the hostess we're promptly informed that could have a table but we would be limited to 1 hour. Ok. I get it. IF you're restaurant isn't half empty!  As we walk in we see 2 friends sitting at a 4 seat table and ask to sit with them. The bratty hostess tells us "just sit down" at the table provided and she"ll "check" to see if we can sit there.  "They only have 30 minutes left at their table" she says.  Really?! Anyway...the food.  I order a beer to start.  It's barely cold and they give me a warm glass to pour it in.  Then I order the yellowtail taquitos --decent.  Then then pomegranate tuna ceviche--very small serving of fish absolutely drenched in a tart pomegranate sauce--not good. Last I had a toro (I think) roll.  It was just ok. Conclusion. Lose the pretentiousness.  Use common sense. If your restaurant is barely half full don't limit the time at a table and train your hostess to at least attempt to be accommodating to a customers requests. For what you charge, the experience should be better.  We felt like you were doing us a favor to allow us to eat there.  Guest what?  Never again.  Only reason why you get 2 stars is for the view.

uhGl4TANrbgEVZNqWihdCw.text: Great experience, the sushi was really good and they had interesting combinations of flavours. The location is obviously amazing, they also have an outdoor bar that makes this place excellent for drinks as well. Also the desserts were delicious, I'd have ordered a second round for sure! Obviously it's not cheap but in London I've eaten paying much more for way less quality and I'm worst locations. I'd definitely want to try more out of their menu to taste what else they have to offer and I'd like to try some more of their cocktails as well.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom

0DwuSWD3Nl5cTMVuYytb8Q.text: Tried to get a 6pm dinner reservation same day on a thursday and it was impossible. I didn't find the reservation agent I spoke with to be that helpful. I had to pry her for an alternate solution about how we could still enjoy the restaurant although the tables were booked.  I asked about the rooftop terrace (knew about from yelp) and it wasn't until then she said it was open for walk in first come first serve. Had I not asked we would have went elsewhere. Anyway so this review is for the outdoor terrace.Another annoying thing is when we arrived at exactly  4 (we were told the terrace opened at 4) we were told that we could not order from the full menu. Would have been nice for the agent to mention that especially when I was originally inquiring about a dinner reservation. Anyway the menu was short, with a selection of appetisers like edamame etc and a small selection of sushi rolls. We went for the samba roll and the yoyogi roll  (something like that ). I ordered the lychee cooler which was nice but didn't give me a buzz and I didn't taste any alcohol present.  We were told it was not possible for the edamame to come first so all the food came out at once. Again a bit annoying. The rolls were very good however. Especially the samba roll.Views were amazing of course. Definitely want to go back to dine in the restaurant with more menu options.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Views from the inside part of the terrace
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Samba roll (left) very good and the yoyogi roll (right)

r2cz0AK3hhaY2lIfw6rnmQ.text: I. LOVE. THIS. PLACE. Made a reservation because I heard about it and it was the first place we went to when we arrived. Unfortunately, our plans got a little flip flopped and we ended up arriving with our luggage, however, the people there were so nice and without hesitation let us store our items in the cloak room. When you walk in there are two men who will ask you for your reservation name and do a quick check if you have any bags. If one of the men is bald with an earring he is honestly the most wonderful! So sweet and made us feel so accommodated. He even gave us a great place to exchange our money down the street. Attentive personnel and great experience. Don't forget to video your ride up and down the elevator!

A29J-idbPVsBaARmr5flpQ.text: SUSHISAMBA is definitely a destination dining experience, both due to 38th floor location and the price of its food.The other Yelp reviews are very useful in terms of food recommendations and we particularly enjoyed the green bean tempura a few people mentioned - the black truffle aioli was divine. We also enjoyed the black truffle vinaigrette with the shrimp tempura (which is quite a substantial dish so good if you're hungry).Our delightful and attentive French-accented waiter recommended several other dishes that had frequently popped up on other reviews, including the Samba London and Sao Paolo rolls. I thought they were both pretty good but I almost missed the taste of the fish (which as far as I could tell was fresh a good quality) with all the other stuff going on. If I went back I would try some of the normal sushi too so as not to miss out on the fish.The kobe beef mini burgers he recommended were a disappointment, and at £6 each a rip off compared to some of the very high quality full size burgers you could get at a fancy street food event for the same price. The wagyu gyoza however, was pretty tasty. I didn't really like the yellowtail taquitos which tasted mainly of the not so interesting sauce they were drenched in.The Sauvignon Blanc we had was particular delicious and served by the snootiest sommelier ever, who did not crack a smile or, as far as I remember, speak. Hilariously, he later nearly dropped the bottle when refilling our glasses.The only blip in otherwise good service came at the end when our waiter clocked off and we were ignored and left waiting for the bill, which if I had any regular readers would be known as my pet peeve.We neglected to go out to the restaurant garden which probably had the best views - ironically the restaurant and bar garden look out over slightly less interesting East London (although I enjoyed spotting my old stomping ground of Bethnal Green). The Friday after works drinks crowd seemed pleasant enough, it's definitely a place where people come to be seen. Cocktails were good, I had what was essentially a rumspresso, always a favourite of mine.Overall, although I generally enjoyed my experience, if I were going to spend this much money on a meal again I would choose Duck & Waffle upstairs or Salt Yard or one of the other really pricey London sushi restaurants I haven't tried yet.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Samba roll and green bean tempura
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Passionfruit cheesecake

WNZbTbCIiLSPizt2k2d3SQ.text: Sushi samba has definitely become one of the most iconic bar restaurants in London. It's location provides amazing views of this beautiful city, unless you are unlucky and a) you don't get a table close to the Windows b) you get a table right next to window overlooking the outdoor space or c) there is too much fog (for which you would blame the weather of course). I have been a few times there and I am always satisfied with the service and how well we are being looked after. Last however that we went, we were 12 of us for a friend's birthday and we spent a few hours eating and drinking. The service was as always amazing and the wine was flowing! We made an agreement with the maitre that we want to pay up to £100 per person and let the chef prepare for us platters to share and different dishes that would allow us to taste the most popular dishes from the menu. We were surprised with what we received for what we were paying and the quantity of the food and platters. It was not what we were expecting exactly. Including the wine and desserts we ended up paying £200 per person and we were not that much satisfied either with what we had for dinner. Nevertheless it was still a nice experience and always a place I would choose to go back. Although I prefer the duck and waffle more but that's another story!

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom

oOpL44xSTOKqNyuoi1yklg.text: Location 5/5Service 5/5Food 4/5 (but we all know the food is what matters ;) )To start we had the edamame and gyoza which were pretty good (nothing special), and the kobe sliders that were amaaaazing (if you can't afford to go all out on the kobe, this is a GREAT compromise). The churrasco rio grande under 'large plates' was also so so good and rich in flavour!! Loved all the sauces it came with and the fact that you could mix and match. We also tried the poussin robata which was excellent as well. All of this was 5/5!!Sushi-wise, I felt like it was disappointing. We ordered Samba London and Tokyo Sky Tree which sound like they would be their most special rolls, but they were a big let down. Really disappointing when you consider it's called Sushi Samba not Everything-Else-Except-Sushi Samba! If I go back, I will make sure to steer clear of the sushi and just eat everything else on the menu!

P5qisYLU443VLyxOWULy8w.text: The biggest appeal to Sushisamba is its location on the 39th floor. The Omakase was good for its price and relatively filling. The restaurant seems to be trying a little too hard- it's not a traditional Japanese restaurant by any means but it also feels cluttered. The wait staff was solid, but the workers at the front door were rude and disinterested in their customers. Overall, go to Sushisamba more for the experience than for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom

jKlFhisnNyxIZrMhJcHFCA.text: Average sushi and greasy tempura followed by hands down one of the worst desserts I've ever eaten (with love from Rio) when we commented to the waitress that the dessert was particularly bad our comments were dismissed and laughed off - this place is over rated to say the least.It has an amazing view but if your curious go for drinks on the patio and save your food experience for a better chef.

ku5XsrG-P5FtGkpv0NNUXw.text: Even though my BF and I didn't have great experience in LV, we decided to try again in London. First, great ambience and spectacular view and good people watch but food didn't measure up to it. For starter we ordered yellowtail and kampachi sashimi both were ok, in fact yellowtail was just blah. For sushi, too much rice for the size of fish. Nothing bad but nothing special either. We wouldn't go back any time soon.

mTkWxuy8g6Yl4Js1KM5ntQ.text: Dreadful experience. After a friend and I trekked halfway across London to try this place we found the entrance guarded by two burly bouncers, one of whom bluntly stated we wouldn't be allowed in wearing regular shoes, smart dress only. I couldn't even reply, I was speechless!Without a word we left and hopped into a Taxi, the taxi driver explained he'd been before and wasn't impressed with the food so we were happy to miss it in the end.Instead we went to Ping Pong, not far away. We were met with incredibly friendly, down to earth staff and promptly served some great food! Highly recommended indeed.

Lcf66a-v25FVU_IPv0-ghQ.text: This is a rip off joint.  Sickly sweet drinks packed with ice to cater to kids using their parent's credit card to feel "grown up" and "kewl", when they aren't experienced enough to know that they are being duped.  The staff are a bunch of amateurs who think it's ok to be a jerk.  Don't bother, London has other venues with good views.

tW5JaG1gzlXVlLkAVFZbkw.text: I would say it's a very touristic place. Maybe too crowded. Suddenly not the most intimate place for special occasion. But they do serve nice dishes

FH4-GqXeVYoM9v9qAsZ6Hw.text: I have been to the Sushi Samba in Las Vegas and Miami, but wasn't impressed with those locations. I had to visit this one when I came to London. I am so glad I did! I was impressed and surprised at how much better this location is! This is the best location. The ride up to the 38th floor, in the glass elevator, is breathtaking! Such a cool way to get to the top of a restaurant. Our experience, since we checked in at security until the very end was nothing, but incredible! The view from the 38th floor is incredible. I would recommend sitting by the window so you can enjoy an amazing view of the city while eating some of the most exquisite and quality Japanese/Brazilian cuisine. The decor is very unique and modern. I really love the red lit up tree in the outside patio. I also highly recommend making a reservation a month in advance. I was able to book a table for two on the night of, but not until 11 P.M. The dishes are also unique and melted in my mouth. Some of the ones that stood out, are:Tempura Green Beans w/ Truffle SauceTORO (forgot what it's called, it's one of the small plates)Samba London RollKobe Beef GyozaThe ambiance is very hip, fun, and trendy. It's a great place for a night out with your friends or a birthday celebration. Our servers were super friendly and fun to talk to! We even had a few laughs with one of them. Ask for Sebastian, he took good care of my sister and I! He is also very entertaining and made our experience fun! I will definitely come back here every time I visit London. Can't beat delicious food, amazing service, and a stunning view! Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in London.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom

DuAHPEFvpAPcQV4ybx85Wg.text: Honestly, pls save your money people. If you after good sushi, pls just go to sticks and sushi. If you are after ambience and having a fine dining experience, pls just go to Nobu. This is what you will experience from Sushi Samba:- Poor table service: dishes are literally placed at the corner of your table with the corners of the dish literally hanging over the edge of the table. Any attempt to try to build rapport with any of the waiters is a lost cause. We said, "what a nice view you have here!" enthusiastically only to be responded with nothing. Having spent £152 for lunch I would have hoped for at least some attentive service. We did not even have a goodbye from anyone as we left the restaurant.- Food is decent but but definitely not worth the money. Ceviche in Shoreditch or Soho is miles better and the sushi from sticks is FAR superior. If you want to just splash out just cuz, then go to Nobu, or Zumba which will offer you better service and food for a similar price. - Decor - the flooring of the main stairs is worn down and beaten up. Same goes for the walls as you exit the elevator of the 39th floor. Please don't be lured by this restaurant like me folks. Just save your money and take your business else where that deserves your hard earned dollars. Hundreds of other places that will gladly take ur money in exchange for decent service and food.

hQeHZm4b1Reiz3rYQArVAg.text: The atmosphere is amazing. Very cool and modern with hints of Japan, most notably the gates when you walk in. The food was overall good. Our appetizers were amazing, but entrees were just ok. We had the octopus, shrimp tempura, plantain chips and edamame for apps. For entree, we did the lamb chops (delish), pork belly (a little tough), and octopus (some burnt) ends from the robata menu. We also did a few rolls which weren't anything special. I was disappointed in the salmon skin roll. Tasted old, and was a little tough to chew through. I had to be careful not to crack my teeth.Overall, the atmosphere and ambiance made up for the food. Great views of the city, and good for people watching.

yLZZFjnPbzvZplZZezNTyg.text: Good food.  Great interior and views.  Laughably pretentious staff.  At the end of the day,  I'm the one dropping £100/head on lunch so please don't patronise me.

DOfTSenTViHxN2IAI590qA.text: Omg What a wonderful outdoor patio!I found the hostess and bartender to be all smiles and welcoming (*eh hm* unlike the 40th floor restaurant, which we escaped due to the cold reception we experienced).Anyone can take the elevator up to the 38th floor here to grab a drink at the bar - no rezzo's needed unless you want to dine in. Warning - that elevator ride is crazy fast and dizzying!On a lovely day or perhaps as the sun is seeing, it is nice to be out on the patio bar under that beautiful lit tree.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom

ZHtduTwEbfd7Ib1_pAieYg.text: If you're looking for the best sushi in town with panoramic views of the London skyline then look no further. Sushisamba offers up a unique fusion of Japanese, Brazilian, and Peruvian cuisine with artistic decor that compliment the stunning views.A glass elevator will whisk you up to the 38th floor so fast it'll make your ears pop, transporting you from the hustle and bustle of the noisy streets below to tranquil surrounds of subtle yet obvious opulence.As expected, once at the top, the views and surroundings are spectacular. The decor is eclectic yet nicely done and adds to the ambience. The outdoor bar with it's large autumn tree centrepiece and the bamboo trellis and lighting in the main restaurant are particularly impressive features.They offer a large selection of cocktails with lots of different options depending on your alcohol of choice, which as expected were very tasty and went down like water.We were particularly hungry so went for the edamame, salt and pepper squid, honey egg plant with sesame, tuna seviche and a large selection of assorted sushi. As it was a special occasion we ended with a chocolate banana cake.Both the food and drink were superb with none of it able to be faulted in any way. I eat a lot of sushi on a regular basis and the food on offer ranks right up there as one of the best i've ever had. It was that good!Let's state the obvious that this place is not cheap. It will put a dent in your wallet but everything about the experience is well worth it. If you're going for a special occasion i'd also recommend booking well in advance as, you guessed it. this great restaurant is extremely popular!

4GsJNCkGijHmLFT8v1XqNA.text: Love sushi samba! My friend and I decided to visit on a Saturday night and we were expecting there to be a really long line but we ended up getting seated right away. The place was packed with a lot of people at the bar and on the patio. We ordered a few rolls and starters and were out of there within the hour. Great food and ambiance - highly recommended.

aLCVeIAj8aJ99sA-wF47Eg.text: Came here to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. In the same building as the famed Duck & Waffle, it offers amazing views during a dinner you surely will not forget.We ordered 2 rolls, the kobe beef, and an order of salmon sashimi. This is the first time I've ever had kobe beef and I finally understand why it is so expensive. The experience of cooking the meat on a hot stone was something in itself. The meat literally melted in my mouth. The rolls were Ezo and California Maki. I usually never go for California Maki rolls, but this version was made with real brown crab, making it extremely delicious and fresh. The 3 pieces of salmon tasted extremely fresh and were definitely very much worth the cost. My favorite part is actually the outdoor bar with the orange light-up tree. It's extremely cozy and romantic. Great place for a special night with your significant other!Pro Tip: Make reservations in advance.

hZW6CCqjIbT2bNZ3tED7ew.text: What an experience! From the incredible view of London to the craft cocktails to the ultra creative menu, Sushisamba offers the full package. We were a table of 8 business people so we asked our server to bring us her favorites to share amongst the group. She started us simple with edamame and green bean tempura. We sampled a variety of small plates and entrees. My two favorites were the black cod - sweet and tender, it is the best cod I have ever eaten, and the crispy taquitos - small fish tacos that literally exploded with flavor upon hitting my taste buds. Our server took excellent care of us. Sushisamba was, for me, a celebration of all five senses. It was an incredible experience and I look forward to visiting again when in London.

lovjTptPFDuQNKh3PDbang.text: Sushisamba served the best sushi I have tasted so far - and above that, this place is the bomb. I'm in love with the interior and thinking about that burning tree gives me goosebumps. The service was extraordinary that evening. Additionally, the matcha dessert they served me back then blew my mind - also you MUST order the coconut cocktail with ceviche! I am definitely coming back soon.

PndYvZOmxI6QBUqq15kOzw.text: Where to begin? Well, if shelling out loads of money for feeling fancy for a while is your thing, then by all means, splurge here. The food, while a tad overpriced, is delicious, prepared to near-perfection, and the portions are tiny. Hey, I didn't say it was perfect.Obviously, they are known for their sushi, but if you're not a fish-eater, like me, they also have some pretty good meat and vegetable dishes that are both savory and memorable. The Mushroom Tabanayaki was both earthy and buttery, and surprisingly filling considering it was all mushrooms. The starters are also great, and I would recommend trying their Wagyu Gyoza, made with some of the highest quality meat around.The drinks, which, dare I say, are pricier than the food, are some of the fanciest and best-tasting I've had since leaving LA. The sake is good, the wine is exceptional, but the cocktails are downright amazing. Some friends and I tried several from their cocktail menu and didn't find a single one that wasn't delicious. If you're a coffee-lover, take my advice: Go for their Café Millonario. Freaking amazing and super smooth as compared to other espresso martinis, with a dusting of dark chocolate to give it the perfect finish. Yes, it is expensive and you may have to book months in advance to eat at the restaurant, but the bar is always open to the public- just be sure to mention to the doorman that you're going up to the bar so they'll let you in without a reservation- and the view at night is absolutely breathtaking.

89q0Vbjqm1uD7avo2mnNIA.text: I'm with a Brazilian friend and we just tried to go to SUSHISAMBA to view the game and were just told we couldn't go in because we were wearing a Brazil jersey! I'm in shock and I'll never again go to this restaurant which should remove samba from their name

GgkyaEyGR0rKov8mqIQtbg.text: I came here for dinner after driving an hour and a half in London traffic . It came highly recommended from a friend and after being redirected by my gps for another 30mins we finally got here. It seems that the GPS was not the only ones doing the redirecting tonight as we were refused entry because of a dress code policy. I am here in town for 2 days from NY and all my anticipation of having Sushi Samba came to an abrupt stop. I even offered to order takeout but you can't. So all roads lead me to the one way street of rejection. I'm gonna take my pride and bruised ego back to NY. I don't have much of a choice. P.S Wish this establishment could do a better job explaining their dress code before hand.

eW2m5E94S9RqUkPPv65vaw.text: View was gorgeous, food was good, but the service was poor.  It shouldn't take 40 minutes to bring out lamb.. and an Asian restaurant should always serve white rice as a side.  Shocker that they don't at this restaurant. I ordered a rose champagne that wasn't cold.  It was also extremely hot inside the restaurant.  Not sure if the AC was out..I have been to two other sushi sambas (Vegas and NYC) and this is by far the worst one.  If it wasn't for the view it would have been a bigger disappointment.

gGY2Pei8oQVYnzZT8K98mA.text: Honestly had THE best evening with friends last night at SushiSamba. Yes the views are great and the decor lovely but we jut loved the food and had really great service too.  Two favourite dishes were Rock Shrimp Tempura and Kuromitso Pork Belly Wraps, amazing. And, as it was my birthday I had a complimentary dessert.We went all out, so it cost a pretty penny but happy to part with the cash if you have such a memorable time.

0Ql5YuEA2CBUczxBhwbTBA.text: Great service but when your gonna fork out 90+ £ that's kinda expected, okay resturant but not for the price and that is commenting on the food,

HqtSIKCvf2JV5RKAkQ1rSQ.text: I gave this restaurant 5 stars mainly for the place, the atmosphere and the view from our table. Perfect for an intimate dinner or a special occasion. The staff is very helpful and kind, ready to guide you in the choice of the food, but I should say that the food is not up to the situation. By the way, we ate 5 different kind of sushi roll, and a shrimp tempura. Everything was amazingly served in beautiful compositions, while the taste was ordinary. You HAVE to book in advance (we only find a place at 11pm, and we book more than 2 weeks before). I hope to be back soon.

l5JvW4EiUO49Y1tME6eMKw.text: The glazed pork belly is the best I have ever had.

bijJmOzlF9Oy03KS8Qr0KA.text: I am in love with this place!! Great location, AMAZING cocktails and a fantastic atmosphere, not a fan of sushi myself but heard its great!

zKX21j1jEzofp8Qw_wx_wA.text: It's very good sushi, not the best I've ever had but the ambiance of the place paired with the quality food is what makes it 5 stars. The view, the music, the drinks, and the rooftop bar is not to be missed.

QTbIp_UyLOcqWo67Y8WrsQ.text: Amazing beyond words!! The view and atmosphere was so fantastic, it was definitely worth the price. The only slightly negative thing was that the music in the dining area was super loud - like being in a nightclub almost - but either they turned it down at some point or then we got used to it, because it didn't really bother us after a while (maybe because the food was so good). Bonus points for serving dinner also quite late (we had a reservation at 11.30pm) which is great for people flying in on a late flight but still needing dinner. All in all, I would recommend the experience to anyone (even if you just go for drinks).

Ea4pOz1j-1rq2KhEm3EiNQ.text: Situated high above the hustle and bustle of London's financial district, SushiSamba is an Asian-fusion restaurant specializing in Japanese cuisine with a South American twist. When I heard that this ultra trendy U.S. micro-chain had opened up a branch in London, I knew that I had to check it out. SushiSamba's menu boasts an eclectic fusion of Japanese, Peruvian and Brazilian fare, so you can expect to see everything from sushi and ceviche to taquitos and tataki on the menu. Unique and interesting yes, but I'm a California Girl and I take my sushi very seriously. I come from a city where Sushi restaurants are as commonplace as pubs are in London or Gelaterias are in Rome. Would SS live up to my expectations?! I wasn't entirely sure at first, but if the crowds were lining up as eagerly as I had been told, I knew that it was doing something right. And I'm happy to report that after an evening's worth of incredible food and wine there was nothing left to doubt....SushiSamba is excellent!The restaurant occupies that 38th & 39th floors of London's Heron Tower; one of the tallest buildings in the city, so if the food isn't enough to get you excited the astonishing near 360 degree views certainly will. The food is on the pricey-side, so I'd definitely coin this as a "special occasion" restaurant, but the quality and presentation certainly make every morsel worth it. I dined on Salted Edemame with fresh lime (a nice South American twist on the Japanese classic), a lipsmackingly delicious plate of Rock Shrimp Tempura with black truffle vinaigrette & spicy mayo, and a Samba London Roll; a tantalizing surf & turf concoction of crab, tuna, scallops, yellowtail, salmon, prawn and Waygu beef mixed with avocado, mayo and a soy reduction. I literally could have written an article on this dish alone. It was bright, colorful, creative and jam packed with texture and flavor. But I wasn't done there. I also tried 3 kinds of Sashimi Omakazi (chef's choice). Nine melt-in-your-mouth slabs of salmon, tuna and turbot served over a bed of crunchy daikon and crushed ice. To drink, the house Sommelier suggested a dry, well-balanced Sauvignon Blanc which paired perfectly with my meal. The wine's crisp qualities cut through the fattiness of the fish while its smooth mineral finish complimented the food's clean taste. And then on to dessert.. oh yeah!  I gorged on a gooey Chocolate Banana Cake and Mochi ice cream paired with a delicious glass of Els Pyreneus, Maury Grenat dessert wine from Roussillon. My mouth is still having wet dreams thinking about that cake! Now for the uncomfortable truth....the bill staggered around the 100 pound mark. But if i'm honest, considering the quality of the menu, the impeccable service and the amazing surroundings, it was definitely worth it...just maybe not every week!

xYWKHo2qhmSMJz8hrxO8Zg.text: You take a glass elevator all the way up (people who are bad with heights should probably look not look). There is a line on the ground level but if you have reservations, they let you right up.   The place is lively and busy, even early.    The view from the top is amazing and the whole place is beautiful and almost surreal. The food was better than I expected, but that is not why I suspect most people go there.

AY0d25UFQDzxKB8zk-nJqQ.text: Wow.  Except for the view, this place has done it all wrong.  Food is mediocre, decor schizophrenic, and staff not always helpful.  Avoid dinner and just go to the bar to check out the view.

1yOviSno4mfJcsYM4PnCpw.text: I am a huge fan of Sushi Samba in South Beach Miami, so I thought we should try the London restaurant.  As usual, I was left feeling happy! The food was amazing and the service was spectacular.  I couldn't ask for a better experience. I would highly recommend asking for the omikase menu....they will give you a sampler of their favorite dishes.  The sake is worth trying at well.  It was a great experience...awesome ambience too. I will be there often going forward.

u5k6Ir9fRih-n9UzliJpFw.text: From the moment you are whisked away from the ground entry of the Heron Tower and delivered with speed to the 38th floor you'll find a little taste of heaven on earth. Immediately the colorful and beautiful reception and bar area of SushiSamba greets you. The views are stunning, breath taking and amazing all at once. The minute I walked onto the patio bar area I almost felt I was on holiday. There you stand under a giant orange-colored artificial tree that is the focal point surrounded by comfortable seating areas. There's a fire-pit and the staff told me some other heating elements would come into play as the weather changes. We were escorted to our table, which was a lovely banquet half circle in the middle of the dining room encompassed by floor-to-ceiling glass. The popular use of old-style filament bulbs is amplified as they have covered the entire ceiling area with what appears to be a few hundred that provide a warm glow after the sun sets. Warm colors are used through out and interesting textures abound. According to my friend who dined with us this restaurant is far more impressive than the New York location. The menu has a nice selection of Brazilian, Japanese and Peruvian inspired foods that the table shares. We started with tempura rock shrimp, edamame and tempura green beans with a black truffle aioli. The rock shrimp... well umm... ROCKS and the other two were great as well. Our server did a fantastic job and made helpful suggestions as we picked other items to share. The flank steak melts in your mouth and the sushi was fresh and flavorful. Our first two picks for wine were already sold out however we ended up with a nice white from Portugal that didn't break the bank. They have only been open a short time so they're working through what I'd call minor kinks but overall it was a fantastic dining experience. After dinner we moved out onto the other patio area where you have an awesome view of the 30 St Mary Axe (The Gherkin), Tower of London, Tower Bridge and The Shard as well as many other sights of London. If you are looking for an impressive place to dine SushiSamba is worth it and made my birthday seem quite special. I found it delicious, delightful and one of my new favorites y'all, I almost want to keep it to myself. Alas my Momma taught me to share, so this American Southerner says it's a must try and maybe I'll see you there.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Assortment of rolls
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Patio bar area
Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Dining room at night

LwZ0ijGQafj_NlwWeEr5Gg.text: Great views, atmosphere, staff and tasty/funky sushi nibbles... Really enjoyed it... But my God, it ain't cheap! And on the way home felt like picking up a McD's to top up my gut. Will I go again? Sure. The views, staff and atmosphere make it worth doing for very special occasions.

aRALHE7GX7_SLSZvtVW1Fw.text: Great views. Beautiful dining room. Miso sea bass is excellent. Quality of sashimi is very good. Specify rolls just ok. Calamari starter was too sweet. Quite pretentious. Worth checking out and under right circumstances a return visit.

4HbP8O5tZXRcM9gIxijFGw.text: I visited this restaurant last August for our friend gathering. We were lucky to sit out side on a lovely summer night. The view was amazing we really enjoyed the sunset over whole London. After very enjoyable meal the bill  was not as I expected too. It put extra smile to our faces. I will go back.

rCxEIYf9HAdiV_nLj2eZtg.text: I was taken here for a business dinner and everything truly tasted amazing.  The waiter chose our dishes so I can't quote the names. There were five of us so we had lots of dishes to share. I would highly recommend the tempura shrimp as all of us loved it and said it was the best shrimp we have had. Perfectly light and crispy with an amazing sauce. Then dishes kept coming! Had it not been a business I would have been snapping photos. The cocktails were very delicious. I had a Nina Fresa to start, I do wish it would have been a larger drink as it was very refreshing. I then tried the Padron Pepper Caipirinha.  Wonderful almost smoky flavor that paired well with the meats that were served at the same time by chance. Managed to also have dessert. Two of us had the chocolate banana cake. I didn't think I would be able to eat dessert and we both finished it off. It was a great end to the meal. The glass elevator ride was a great view but it was a rainy evening. I would love to go back in warmer weather and dine on the outside patio to enjoy the view. We did have to get security checked before going up the elevator.  Not a problem, just wanted all to be aware.

vmr_CTY8YsBh0LG4_99xLw.text: After getting over the initial shock of being transported 38 floors in a see through lift. I really enjoyed eating here...service was great and food was delicious.highly recommend the fish tacos. The view isn't too bad either

O_Jt7oIXNAW8UWVVoliCmw.text: I think I understand the model being used at Sushi Samba: South American flavors are strong and varied, but such restaurants can't command high prices. Sushi is something people are prepared to spend up big on. Let's fuse the two and hit hard!From the 6 dishes I tasted, it was the most pure Japanese that were impressive. Well, even as I wrote that last sentence, I realised it wasn't entirely true... The yellow tail taquitos are excellent and amazingly tasty, but the tempura prawns lacked the finesse you would expect. Wagu gyoza was more than simply beef.. I would order that again. The London Roll was very good sushi, with sauces on the side. I can only describe the Tuna Seviche (sic) as a miss; way too much flavor competing with the delicate fish. Overall, the food is a 4. The overall score must be reduced as result of the rushed and overly opinionated service. Will try once more, and revise this review if appropriate.

HLqps4U7h0UOSXX8VdCLhA.text: Lovely place, went there after an impulse. 39th floor is good enough to enjoy the wonderful london night. I don't feel the need to go to the shard anymore. Unique selections of cocktails with an infusion of Japanese. Didn't get a chance to try out the food as Friday evening is quite busy. Will definitely try out next time

qUsBJkr5eE6dewHiV3hbWQ.text: Typical 'English but trying to be NYC' boring place with lame people in ugly polyester floral prints - even the men. It is in an interesting location, because it is relatively high up, but beyond that, skip it. The staff are snobby, or perhaps depressed, it was hard to tell. We went on a sunny day and walked up to the outside bar for drinks. We were handed a drink menu, decided, ordered, and were told we couldn't order drinks there - only wine. We were sent to their TINY, totally understaffed, totally crowded bar inside for our drinks. It took AGES to order, and ages for them to make it. As usual in London, the drinks hardly had any alcohol in them but looked cute. It was seriously overpriced. I've been to the one in Miami Beach, and in NYC, and I loved them both. The London one is crappy because it is just so... Uncool, and un-chic, and lacking in service and friendliness. Sad. Oh well...

Az2cm35EAUuc0qY57JohLQ.text: The food is overpriced. This is where you take tourists for the view. Now I don't mean to be cruel by giving 3 stars, but the food is overpriced and the quantity is lacking. The cocktails however.... Worth every penny. If I would do it again I would just do the cocktails in the bar and look out at the city. No need for food.

cDBzEy2jZtxJSAxNQJPdng.text: Definitely overrated. There are better restaurants in London with views similar such as Oblix in the Shard. I ordered the jalepeno mozzarella sushi roll. It did not say the roll came with mayonnaise on it and I do not eat mayonnaise. When I asked for a new one the waiter tried to fight with me and told me I ordered it. Being from America, I never receive service like this and would not expect this at one of the most highly acclaimed restaurants in London. They finally brought me out a new roll and charged me for 2. After arguing with the waitstaff they finally took it off. My friend had the black cod and it was good but a very small portion as expected. The rest of us had sushi rolls that were OK at most.

6cnjk5sj-GqaXSLMb4Pr5g.text: Absolutely stunning location with amazing views and the sushi is even better. Only downfall is the price but that can be expected in Central London and the views definitely make it worth the while. Also if you are planning on going on a friday or saturday be sure to book well in advance, upto two months!I can't wait to go back!

zoT2zlsQg_iNnD-mmLfnsg.text: Came here on a business trip and by recommendation of my boss. I went straight for their signature rolls : Samba London, which is a fantastic sampler, and then the El Topo - truly unique!!  Was here during the week of the month that they highlight Kobe beef. Had to definitely order some. Wasn't disappointed. I like bourbon so I went for the Japanese Manhattan. Excellent. High atop the 40th floor, the 5 second ride up the glass elevator has breathtaking views. Enjoy.

S7eeMorQJ3fNWkv2dQapBw.text: One of the best sushi restaurants I've ever had. Also tried the Kobe beef sliders as an appetizer- BEST beef ever (they are on of the 30 restaurants in the world to serve this type). Melts in your mouth- a must try! We did a selection of rolls (Samba, Tiger, Yoyogami (sp?) and California) all were great and tasted amazing. Try the wasabi mayo as well :)

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. The best sushi.. Samba, Tiger, Yoyogami, and California

Hgj3Up9cuxMOptuV6D4NYg.text: I'm a little torn on my rating, because if it was just me, I would have given it 3 stars.  However, my friends were raving about their food and asked me whether it was "4 or 5 yelp stars" (not sure it's a good thing that I'm now notorious for yelping?), so I'm going to give the place the benefit of the doubt that I just ordered poorly.  Overall, it was an awesome place to visit once -- I just don't think I'd go back, except perhaps for drinks.Atmosphere: Over-the-top, stunning, trendy.  The views are great, the crowd is well-dressed, the orange tree outside is just plain cool.  4.75 stars.  (It loses 0.25 stars on decidedly strange music choices).Service: Besides the grumpy doorman, excellent.  Surprisingly we were seated as soon as we arrived for our Sunday evening reservation.  4 stars.Cocktails: Eh.  Two of us ordered them, both of us were underwhelmed.  Mine tasted like juice, hers was too strongly flavored with an odd mix of flavors.  They were really pretty, but not worth the 12-13 quid.  2.5 stars; I'd try a different one to have an excuse to come back for the views.Food: I had the calamari as a first course, and it was excellent.  Delicious sauce and mixture of fresh onions and tomatoes as well.  I was really, really excited for the second dish and dessert after this...unfortunately, neither of my other two dishes were at the same level.  The foie gras sushi, while creative and quite "cute", had far too much rice compared to the other ingredients (plus, there were only 4 little pieces in the roll).  The dessert was a stunning display of chocolate mousse, sorbet, and flourishes, but all the actual flavors were just average.  However, my friends really enjoyed their sushi and dessert choices (including the ezo and the strawberry maki for sushi, as well as pretty much every dessert on the menu), so I'm guessing that I just was unlucky.  (Or I'm just more critical!)  So 3-4 stars on food, depending on who you ask.Price: Bad, but you're paying as much for the view as anything else, and it wasn't unreasonable given that it's obviously an upmarket place.  Two dishes + cocktail was 55 for me.All-in-all, it's a scene that's definitely worth checking out at least once, but don't expect it to be the meal of the century.Tip: We had to book several weeks in advance for a table for 5 on a Sunday night, so keep that in mind.

Ab31NoOE5UcdNScQeSdzLA.text: The food is good but thoroughly overpriced.  The restaurant hostesses are as expected, unfriendly which sets a bad tone. It's best for a drink at the bar with an incredible view but good luck trying to get up for just a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Gherkin view from the bar

nO5MZ84UnCB2I7b53z7YDg.text: I wasn't majorly impressed with this place, so I'll keep it brief.The wait time was ridiculous - we had a booking and showed up on time, but still had to wait a whole 45 minutes before being seated. This meant that I spent a lot more than I intended to, because I bought two of their overpriced cocktails before I'd even had a chance to look at the menu.The food was good, but it was also very overpriced and the service bordered on awful. When we complained about a mixup that meant one of our party had eaten a dish intended for two people and we had to order an extra one, one of the managers actually laughed in our faces. Eventually we got the discount that we requested, but we were made to feel awkward and, considering we had spent a lot of money, it seemed petty to behave so rudely when we had made a perfectly reasonable request - the mistake was theirs, not ours.Yes, the views are fantastic, but I'd rather go somewhere with a better vibe. I imagine that this place will ride the wave of hype for a while, but most people I know who have been there have been unimpressed by the rude staff and greedy management. The fusion food isn't particularly innovative, either.

GK7rznsH_EYGqUQycHWe_g.text: Very nice ambience and great location with fantastic views. Only downside was that the menu could have been explained a little better by the staff. Overall nice experience

InbPjZ3ag65fOWEXmvywXg.text: Three stars based on a much higher expectations of the food for the price.  We had sashimi & flank steak.  Flank steak was good, and the fish was very fresh, but I was not impressed with the presentation or the flavors.  The fusion of three Regions was a little confusing for the pallet.  Staff and service were first rate.  Attentive team with a clear enthusiasm for what they're doing.  Deco was strange as well.  Too much happening.

7IDKUDxRbVYJ_U_6GnnlJw.text: This is a rating for the bar only as I've not had a chance to visit the restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised when I friend and I arrived at the heron tower at 8.30pm on a Thursday night and managed to be granted access to the bar one level below sushi samba. Although the drinks were fairly expensive, having the chance to see the view was completely worth the prices. The whole bar is surrounded by glass making a panoramic view of London and the outdoor area is great for those rare warm nights! Great if you can't quite afford to go up the shard and still wanting to impress a friend or date!

wbdSVW4f8n_hsgRaLrizBg.text: I gotta say, I had no expectations at all, it by far was one the best places I have been to in London, the food was amazing, ambience and interior is very good, waiters were attentive and the view was just so incredible.I also gotta point out, price wise it's very good and reasonable. :)

6OhOO7tXsfj6N8hDrn7f6g.text: I was here on 09-03-14. This place is extremely overrated.  I ordered the SAO PAULO roll and a 100ml glass of Saki.  I expected something impressive, but it was mediocre for £35.  The hostesses didn't smile and were not very helpful. The elevator ride to the 39th floor is nice, great views.  I'm not at all interested in going back.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. This was my receipt.

Ytl5h2L0usiEJ-oraDjmfA.text: Sushisamba has breathtaking views of the London skyline but the visuals are not enough to excuse indifferent service and shockingly mediocre sushi at outrageous prices.My wife and I arrived at Sushisamba but still had to wait an inexplicable fifteen minutes for a table while the dining room sat mostly empty. The best views in the restaurant are from the bar where the top of the Gherkin Building is at eye level. This alone might justify a trip up to the restaurant, but stay in the bar and pay for a beer to absorb the sights.When we finally got to our table, we ordered the large omakase for £55. Omakase is supposed to be a series of sushi pieces of the chef's selection designed to highlight the freshest  fish available. Instead, we received what was basically a chirashi bowl of salmon, tuna, shrimp and other sashimi pieces so typical they could have been ordered off of the lunch menu of any sushi restaurant in any city for a quarter the price. Many of the pieces were bland and not fresh.Despite the beautiful views, SushiSamba was a highly disappointing experience.

9wqgV2cn7OtE6HzGqDjffg.text: Only came for cocktails. Amazing views of London. Crowded. Rich Hipster central. The cocktails are pretty overpriced for what they are, but I guess you're paying for the view. I ordered a dirty martini and PAID for it only to be told ~5-10 minutes later that they had no olives or olive juice. Maybe I am wrong but I feel like a martini is a pretty standard cocktail for a cocktail bar. Like I said, great views.

PgoVDDeY9k9yg1zB_18CKA.text: I didn't really like this place, it was too overcrowded, the atmosphere wasn't great and the waiter kept on forgetting about us. It was my friends birthday and I took her out for a meal. The sushi weren't too bad but you get my better sushi if you go to Yasnin in South Kensington. Although, I guess this place could be fun under different circumstances.

aICdd86CCr5FnHyemC_YQQ.text: Positives: Great views of the city. SO SOs: The food and cocktails.Negatives: Price, Service, Atmosphere.Had a reservation here on a Tuesday evening for a specific table (for a view). When we arrived, we got "big-dogged" and was told by the host that table was now being held for the chef's friend. When we got seated to a random table, no less then 4 people asked if we wanted to order drinks, in the first 10 minutes. An hour in, we ordered a couple drinks because they would not stop asking and we thought maybe there was a drink minimum.  we got a couple of cups filled with crushed ice and little bit of water down fluid and a stick ($24USD). The waiter suggested and swore by the fried squid. It was crap. It reminded me or a  bag of stale pork skins minus the seasoning. I also got some miso soup, which was the worst and most expensive miso soup I've ever had. We ordered some other appetizers, some steak think, pork belly, tempera shrimp; all pretty good, but not worth the cost at all. Also ordered 2 or 3 sushi rolls. Again, good, but not anywhere near worth the money. Service was pretty questionable too. It wasn't bad, just lackluster. Floaters would come around, but seemed bothered if we asked for something, and we seemed to be always looking for our waiter. For the type of money we spent (over $100USD a person) I expect the waiter to telepathically read my mind. All and all a pretty crappy experience for the kind of reviews this place has. if you come, its 100% for the views.

OXZp3xZ318F2oQjMIIhJAQ.text: The whole experience was great, unforgettable, shame about the rude bartenders (just two), but besides that it was a very good experience. Not the perfect place for a birthday (you have to bring your own cake and pay for them to bring it out, not ideal), but besides that it's a very good place.

J0XQOnfQF_EqRzqsKLRX9Q.text: *** Tourists Beware ***Although I did not expect to get a reservation the day before, when I called they let me know I could bring my wife to the bar for some drinks and to enjoy the view. We only had a day of vacation remaining and wanted to do something special, so we journeyed to SushiSamba (it is a journey for tourists, as it is not near any of the tourist spots) ... only to be turned away. The first explanation was that there was no room, which did not make sense given that it was 4:30pm. They explained that a special reservation was using the bar area. Interestingly, when I asked why reservations did not mention that -- instead inviting us to come -- the response was that reservations doesn't always know what they're doing. Because that is simply impossible to believe given how important reservations are to this establishment, I asked whether that meant that customers should not rely upon or trust reservations. Naturally the answer was no, and that is when the next line of reasoning emerged. The door man next explained that there was a "smart elegance" dress code (note: the website clearly states "smart casual"). While we were not in bespoke suits (we had been touring all day!), I was wearing a button-down, jeans, and a Barbour jacket, and my wife was wearing dark washed designer jeans and a Patagonia jacket. Certainly "smart casual." As the prior explanation clearly was not the case, I then concluded aloud that the dress code was the only issue at play, to which he said if we wanted to go home, change, and come back when the bar was lighter that 'may' work. Given that this was only supposed to be a quick drink with a nice view to conclude a lovely London trip, it is not hard to imagine that we had no interest in spending another £40+ round trip cab fare, only to arrive at much more popular time and 'may' get in. No thanks. I am not a routine reviewer, but I felt compelled to provide this insight to anyone - particularly tourists considering spending their precious vacation time to make the inconvenient journey. I only wish we'd googled this issue beforehand, as there are many other similar or worse stories (see, e.g., telegraph.co.uk/women/wo…). There are too many other wonderful options in London to risk wasting the time and effort with SushiSamba.

fVViMTaS_V_8_XxnD7yEVQ.text: We came at around 8:30 on a Friday night for drinks, and luckily the queue to get in was only about 10 minutes. The view speaks for itself; London has surprisingly few options for sky bars, and this is a gem in the middle of the City. This venue is so different than the Sushi Samba I went to in New York; the chain has done well in picking a unique location and making it a trendy bar as well. The place is decorated as if it's straight out of the Great Gatsby, over the top with chandeliers and bright colours. We tried to order food but that's impossible unless you have a table; there's no option of ordering at the bar or anything like that. I ordered the Nina Fresa and we walked around to enjoy the views before leaving to get food somewhere else.

kLjSP6d-OqBiXxukc8frJQ.text: A very interesting and cool experience. The. View is very nice and the view is wonderful. Bit the food is pricy and you have to book in advance in order to get a seat. But the bar is. An alternative if you want to get a great look on London from above.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. The food

ckiXwjev6hpEK7X7iOMQ7A.text: Come here for the view ! Its expensive , but its sushi . Its fancy , but not too much. As a Tourist absolute a place to go .

o2FG3TW9TaxVWr3wWlNonA.text: Dined here on several occasions. Nightmare to ever get a reservation but always worth it. Outside garden is so beautiful with a red fairy light tree and views over the city. Sushi is delicious. Highly recommend black cod and shrimp tempura.

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Black cod

q3duyR4jivPsG4axbEQ72Q.text: Dear Guest Relations Manager of SushiSamba. You obviously didn't read my review - I did not enjoy the service, it was very inattentive, which is quite ironic if you think about it! Also, my name is not Ashleigh H.... I suggest that 'copy and paste' is not your friend.

iByvpSnCeDPgq_cJ3xbP7w.text: AMAZING is all I can say! Food was fabulous, atmosphere was more than enjoyable and the view was breath taking!Our waiters were extremely helpful and attentive. Food portions were excellent and more than enough for the 6 of us. Food was brought out as it was ready which was so nice.This place is pricey but I would 100% recommend treating yourself.You must have a reservation!

2phtXNSS8uFFHtS7ZFU3EA.text: Food was fantastic.  Best sushi I've tasted, which is saying a lot as I am a Japanese food fan.  Each sushi had multiple flavours from interesting ingredients - the chef really did well combining the best of east (core food) and west (method of preparation).  The other non-sushi dishes our party of 6 tried were pretty decent too.Don't be intimidated by the extensive menu as the waiter will give recommendations.  We pretty much went with what he advised.  The yellowtail tacquito was really really good.Very nice views of the city as well.  Only downer was that the waiter chased us out before we could look at the dessert menu - that's our life as walk-ins.  Will definitely get a reservation next time!  Oh, and you already know that this is not cheap right?  Fortunately, my hosts picked up the tab :-)

2Dd4IUdTJ6Cj9NXtImmf3Q.text: I'd been to Sushi Samba a few years ago and was blow away by the food. I decided to go back again recently as a treat to myself before leaving London and was again really impressed. It is pretty pricey but so worth it as the taste of the food is amazing. We had a selection of dishes chosen by our waiter which were all great. I especially loved the black cod dish, the flavours they used just complemented each other so well. Both times I've come away from the restaurant saying it was the best meal I've ever had.Apart from the food being to die for, the restaurant itself is beautifully designed and has a stunning view of London. There is also a nice bar too which serves delicious cocktails.If you are looking for somewhere with the wow factor, I would recommend this place.

YOEif-tQfGR3TMhYaSkYzg.text: Wow fantastic viewsGood drinks not my favorite ones of this trip but still goodOverall pretty good! Would come back again for sure.YELLOWTAIL TAQUITOS- pretty good! didn tliek the avocado as much but still pretty goodROCK SHRIMP TEMPURA - pretty good and i liked it more and more after continuing to eatSALON NIKKEI SEVICHE- my dining partner and new husband's favorite dish! i have to admit the addition of celery into it was AMAZINGGGGG. i love it and i dont even like celery that much!CHILEAN SEABASS ANTICUCHOS- this was my favorite. a little on the too sweet side, but i liked it. the corn was weird though.WAGYU TE AMO ROLL- nvm i change my mind, this one is my favorite one. it was sooo good and the quail egg on top is just so cute. :) the servers here are also very very nice!

6sUt-8LzoItBIuEuOaA9TA.text: Had my birthday here and although it was a cloudy rainy day, the food and service made up for it all. The atmosphere was heaving, the food was so yummy, from the padron peppers, to the Peruvian corn and chicken skewers to the mains of sushi to the dessert of Apple foam, sorbet and garden mess. Want to go back again and try something new. Best place

OQ_6u9Mik8KmduB-gpdDig.text: Exciting news...Sushisamba, the great Latin Japanase fusion restaurant from NYC has arrived in London. Taking over the top floors of Heron Tower, expect to be wowed by great panoramic views of London....it's possible to even see the well-lit Olympic Stadium and the adjacent red monstrosity that is the Olympic Orbit from the expansive walls of glass. The space itself is stunning...be sure to check out the roof-terrace bar, complete with fire pits and an amazing central bar wrapped around a gold coloured tree (see pic). The dining room has soaring ceilings, hundreds of drop down unique lights, and a great overall buzz. Sushisamba is definitley a see and be seen venue.As for the food, it did not disappoint.  We ordered the trio of sashimi tiradito... basically marinated sashimi...the salmon in a ponzu sauce was fantastic. Other standouts were the wagyu gyoza and black miso cod. I also enjoyed the big-eye tuna roll. The only item that disappointed was the El topo roll...but mozzarella on fish...not sure what my friend was thinking when he ordered that. Prices are as high as the elevation of the restaurant, but not outlandish for the food.Based on looks alone, Sushisamba is worthy of 5 stars. However, truly dreadful service knocks it down not one but two stars. The team clearly has a lot of kinks to work out...the staff is not ready for prime-time and really left us disappointed. First, whilst at the bar, I saw two separate instances where the bar staff was pushy and up-selling customers to buy bottles of wine instead of glasses. Although not super busy (it was a Monday night), it took a while to be served. When we were seated at the table, we were asked not once but twice asked to move tables.... because they screwed up and needed to  push tables together to accomodate a larger table. They also asked another table to move after we refused to move a second time.... restauranteur rule one...don't ask people to relocate after you seat them! The sake sommelier was also very pushy/annoying (and not so informed about sakes) clearly directing us to the most expensive bottles. She needs training in professionalism and more knowledge about sake. The waiter was also a bit unprofessional at times and made weird jokes where it was unclear if he was being rude or funny. Lastly, while we were warned that the food comes out as it is made, the waiter brought out 8 of our 10 dishes all at once and all within the first 10 minutes...which was just silly to be honest and probably should have been better spaced...ie give people a bit of time to enjoy their edamame before bringing out the mains. The waiter should have seen there was no room on the table before continuing to rapidly bring out dishes.Despite the dreadful service, I'm willing to give sushisamba another chance...the space is killer, and if they can work out their opening issues and up-level the service to an acceptable level, this could easily be one of the top asian fusion spots in London, but for now it is a mediocre 3 stars.
