3_YzIUhUidDoYY3tnbqaaw.text: The view. The food. The service. Perfection from start to finish.

fBk1pFXQbbBaD4w_5Y86Eg.text: Sushi Samba is a fantastic place to have a drink and admire the London skyline. If you are looking to eat, you need to book well in advance and the food is pricey for the portion sizes. However, that is what you pay for the premium view! If you get queazy be sure to stand back in the elevator as it shoots up the 40 floors to the top of the Heron Tower!I think it is best to go here for a post work drink or a cocktail with friends who are visiting London. The staff are pretty friendly and the drinks not too pricey. The decor is interesting and at sunset the view to the SW is nothing short of breathtaking! There is a fantastic outdoor smoking area on the NE side with a bar, but be quick as it fills up very quickly on nice evenings.

wykH2ERwFlO_-cj0kTC8KA.text: SushiSamba is the real deal all around!  You know when you go to a restaurant for the view and have little expectations with everything else?  SushiSamba delights on every level: view, food, service and surprise.  The staff is excellent and super friendly.  We were promptly seated and greeted by 3 professionals: 1st to orient us on their menu, style of service/sharing and recommendations based on our questions, 2nd a saki sommelier, and 3rd our attentive server.  Oh, and a manager checked in at least once.  The items were beautifully presented and a culinary delight.  Of the 4 "fancy" dinners we had while in London, this one was #1.  Don't miss it!

bTjBIR4hBR2id7di42RPkg.text: I have been to all Sushi Samba (Miami, New York, Las Vegas, London), so I'm obviously sold the this establishment, but I have to admit, the London one, with its great staff (Milton, Alexandre, Camille and others), fantastic view of the city and a great trendy/classy style, is definitely my favorite.  If you never been to Sushi Samba, your missing something.  Thy the crispy taquito (yellowtail), Tiradito (yellowtail) and El Topo (my favorite).

photos.caption: Photo of SUSHISAMBA London - London, United Kingdom. Crispy taquito (yellowtail), green been tempura, Tiradito (yellowtail), El Topo all better appreciated with a Chucumber cocktail

7WpaCAmR8xwhqpDPwMeeYw.text: I would give Sushi Samba zero stars if I could. This restaurant is the type that treats their customers with zero respect and they believe that is the cool and hip thing to do. The food is only okay. In my opinion, I believe they are taking a lot away from sushi which is in itself a complex and delicious cuisine. It is the attitude of our waiter that upset me so much that I will never recommend this place to anyone. He actually snorted at me when I tried to pay for the bill while my boyfriend was in the restroom. Then, he laughed at me with a cook behind the sushi counter and THEN refused to take the check from me. A. It is none of his business if I want to pay for our meal. It is no ones place to judge us. B. How dare him for laughing at me. Why would any decent human think that's okay? It made me feel EXTREMELY awkward to sit there trying to wave him over and have him refuse. So, if you're in for over priced okay food with the worst service I have ever experienced- go for it. If you're into that kind of thing, it's the best crap ever.

AlnT_M8dWrz_kMBUgNw2tQ.text: We managed to bag a reservation to this place and took our parents to show them the sights and try the food we had heard so much about.Everyone knows where this place is, so I won't harp on about the view, suffice to say its of London in panoramic and it's amazing.The restaurant is funky and modern, seating is comfortable and in most you can make the most of the view. The staff are all top notch, very quick and attentive and they know the menu! (To me this is what separates some restaurants from others, invest in your staff) We went for a selection of food, some sushi, mains and starters. The food is all interesting with the fusion aspect. Mostly ordered on recommendations. Everything we had was very tasty. Although I loved the overall experience I couldn't help think that you are paying for an experience rather than the food, and there is no point denying that it's expensive to eat here!! To be completely honest I've had better food in other Japanese fusion restaurants..... But not always the service, and never that view (apart from duck and waffle, lol) I'm never going to be a regular here but I'd definitely come back if invited.

DiiMa-f-7-3gfkzYm8S3iA.text: Based near Liverpool Street, inside the Heron Tower is Sushisamba bar and restaurant. Both the bar and restaurant are pricy. My boyfriend and I had booked a table at Sushisamba in July, the actual date of our reservation was in September as that's how far in advance you need to book! We were expecting to be blown away by the food but it just didn't happen for me. Some dishes were very tasty but some dishes I wasn't very keen on. The menu is quite confusing so we had to have the waiter explain it to us. Nonetheless, it was a nice evening and the restaurant has a nice and chilled ambience. Our meal in total, with a bottle of wine, came to £250 roughly. We went to the bar afterwards and had a few cocktails. The cocktails are great, I'd definitely recommend going to the bar but not sure if I'd recommend the restaurant as the food wasn't quite as good as I expected it to be. I would have rated it 5 stars if the food was more enjoyable.

7srY7-ipy_fW21Q8276U8w.text: Delicious cocktails and beautiful outdoor bar. The only painful part is the price, but what do you expect when you ride a lift 39 floors to get to the place?I admit I haven't eaten here yet. I've only bummed around at the bar. The mango cocktail is delicious. There's one bartender who's hilarious, and if you tip them and chat with them, they are more than willing to pour what's left in the shaker into a separate glass for you or top you off with an extra splash of liquor.

Qu7JgM7ZZP6hU7f-BoZ7hw.text: I could not believe the look I got when I tried to go and eat in this place. It was absolutely ludicrous! Me and my friend went to go and eat here, with it supposedly having the best rooftop view as it is 43 floors up above the ground, I really wanted to see it. When we arrived at the door, the girls before us, dressed in heels and their hair done etc, were smiled at and spoke to nicely. They didn't have a reservation but they were allowed to go inside.However, me and my friend behind were not allowed in, because we didn't have a reservation and from the look that she gave us (swift full body check out) she didn't think we looked suitable to go inside. I was so angry, we had been struggling to find it all day in London, and when we got there, this happened! I shall not be trying again. As is clear, would not recommend to anyone of working class, unless you wear your best clothes.

5QGv3VXlDkiHDxZvxHPJWw.text: Sushi Samba is pretty good. You go there for the view as well as the food.They have a cocktail bar which is pretty good, a club section which is only really open at weekends, a sushi bar where you can grab a quick bite to eat, a restaurant area where you can have a fancy meal with an excellent view over London (which has outside seating with a view), as well as another outdoor area which is (I think) unique in London, being so high up. It's a shame you can't see as much from it.The sushi is quite pricey and quite good, but the place is let down by the poor level of service and lack of chilli sauce. The only one they have tastes ok but is massively oil based so you can't have too much of it.I much prefer Duck & Waffle upstairs, but they are different kinds of food and you won't fail to impress anyone by taking them here (unless they are afraid of heights)!
